did.physdesc: Photographic Print; 7 3/8 x 9 1/2 Copy 1 was ripped in half and carefully realigned and taped along the edges of the photograph.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Sr. He is wearing a suit and tie.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this photograph. Copy 1: Photograph was ripped in half, but both pieces were still with the album. Photographer was Charles M. Hiller. From an album belonging to Allie Burwitz, Leland Sparks Sr.'s wife. The album has a mottled cover with black leaf pages. Located in Box 3, Folder 3. Copy 2: Caption around image: Allie's Husband and Father of Nancy Lee & Leland Jr./Leland John Sparks. Photograph is located in a photo album commemorating the centennial birthday of the year. Located in Box 12

separatedmaterial.p: Copy 1 was removed from the album for repair and sleeving

did.physdesc: Copy 1 - Photographic print; 1 1/2 x 4 Copy 2 - Photographic print; 1 1/2 x 3 1/2

scopecontent.p: Portrait of Allie Burwitz wearing a dark colored dress.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this photograph. Copy 1 - Caption under image: Allie Myrtle Burwitz. Located in Box 12. Copy 2 - Located in Box 3, Folder 3.

separatedmaterial.p: Copy 2 - Photograph was attached to 01093 with tape. The tape was removed so that the photographs could be sleeved separately.

scopecontent.p: A hand colored postcard depicting John Sparks sitting behind a large conference table. Caption on the bottom: Last photograph taken of Governor Sparks. Faintly written on verso (was written and then erased): about 1910, probably Calif.

Postcard depicting the governor's mansion during winter. The railings are decorated with wreaths and lights. Caption on verso: At Christmas time! Governor's mansion Carson City, Nevada. Photographer: Adrian Atwater.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this photograph.

did.unittitle: Formal dining room in the Governor’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a dining room with a wooden dining table, 12 chairs around the table, and a chandelier above the table. The chairs are upholstered with blue velvet. Beyond the dining room is a living room. Caption on verso: Formal Dining Room Governor's mansion Carson City, Nevada. Photographer: Adrian Atwater.

did.unittitle: Reception room in the Governor’s mansion1

scopecontent.p: Postcard depicting a view of a room with a circular wooden table, a piano, couches and chairs around the edge, and red curtains over the windows. There are columns on either side of the doorway into the room. Caption on verso: The reception room Governor's mansion Carson City, Nevada. Photographer: Adrian Atwater.
Postcard of the Nevada State Capitol front entrance. There is snow on the trees and grounds in front of the Capitol. Caption on verso: State Capitol Carson City, Nevada. Photographer: Adrian Atwater.

relatedmaterial.p: Same negative used for image as photograph 00844. This postcard was processed with warmer colors more prominent (i.e. red tinted).

scopecontent.p: Postcard of the Nevada State Capitol front entrance. There is snow on the trees and grounds in front of the Capitol. Caption on verso: State Capitol Carson City, Nevada. Photographer: Adrian Atwater.

relatedmaterial.p: Same negative used for image as photograph 00843. This postcard was processed with cooler colors displayed more prominent (i.e. blue tinted).

did.unittitle: Gray Reid Wright Building and Arlington House, Carson City

scopecontent.p: Postcard of the Gray Reid Wright Co. building and the Arlington House in Carson City, Nevada. In front of the buildings is a large group of people and several horse-drawn carriages.

relatedmaterial.p: There were eight copies of this postcard in the collection. Since none of the postcards were written on, one representative was kept in the collection.

did.unittitle: Along the Truckee River, Reno, Nevada

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard depicting the Truckee River winding through a valley. Along the edges of the river are ranch houses and barns. Caption on front: Along the Truckee River, Reno, Nev.

Handcolored postcard of Morrill and Clark Halls behind a wall and gate. There are five girls on the left of the gate walking and talking. On the right are eight men standing. Seven are in military uniforms while the last is in civilian clothes. Caption on front: 5026 - Gateway, University of Nevada, Reno.

Handcolored postcard of four Paiute women, two adults and two children. The women are sitting on chairs. One of the girls is standing in front of the woman on the left. The other is a baby wrapped in a cradleboard. Caption on front: 5030 - Group of Piute Indian Women. Reno, Nevada.

Handcolored postcard of three men, two women, a boy, and two dogs standing outside of an open top teepee. There is a wooden covering behind the teepee. Caption on front: 1826 - Piute Indian Camp. Nevada.

did.unittitle: Baby with top hat, cigar, and Freemason medallion

scopecontent.p: Postcard depicting a drawing of a baby in a diaper. He is wearing a top hat, dress shoes, and a Freemason medallion around his neck. Caption on front: I'm one, too. Handwritten on verso: 5/27 Brit-American paying off. About 15 cts on dollar. Charging board. WFHalley. Addressed to: 467 Mr. Chas Sparks Reno Nevada.

Handcolored postcard of a cliffside going down into a Lake. There are mountains on the other side of the lake. Caption on verso: Rubicon point, Lake Tahoe, California. Handwritten on verso: Dear Chas: How is the boy any way Ned & me are leading a very easy life. Wish you could come up. Bert Nixon. Addressed to: Mr. Chas Sparks Reno Nevada.

Handcolored postcard depicting a drawing of a woman from the shoulders up. She is surrounded by abstract shapes of blues and purples. Caption on front: violet. Handwritten on front: My latest photo A.N. Addressed to: Mr. Charles Sparks, Reno, Nevada.
Postcard from a cyanotype depicting six men dressed in ranching gear standing in a valley. The man third from the left is John Sparks.

Photograph of a boy's silhouette. A heart has been drawn around it in crayon. Handwritten on front: To My Valentine. Handwritten on verso: love to Grandmother Leland. Most likely from Leland Sparks Sr. to one of his grandmothers.

relatedmaterial.p: The top and bottom of the photo have tape attached. There is a thin layer of brown paper stuck to the tape.

scopecontent.p: Silhouette photograph of a woman in profile. She has a small hat at the top of her head. No identification. Stamped on front: J.B. Slinn Premier Artist Midwinter Fair 1894, San Francisco, CAL.

did.unittitle: Charles Sparks with some fraternity brothers

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of five young men standing outside a building labeled 704. They are all wearing suits and hats. Second from the left is most likely Charles Meigs Sparks. Possibly a group photo of Charles with some fraternity brothers.

did.unittitle: Charles Sparks with some fraternity brothers

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of five young men sitting outside a building labeled 704. They are all wearing suits and hats. The man on the left is most likely Charles Meigs Sparks. Possibly a group photo of Charles with some fraternity brothers.

did.unittitle: Charles Sparks with some fraternity brothers

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of five young men sitting outside a building labeled 704 with their backs to the camera. They are all wearing suits and hats. The man on the left is most likely Charles Meigs Sparks. Possibly a group photo of Charles with some fraternity brothers.

did.unittitle: Charles Sparks with some fraternity brothers

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of five young men sitting or crouching outside a building labeled 704. They are wearing suits and hats. The man on the left is most likely Charles Meigs Sparks. Possibly a group photo of Charles with some fraternity brothers.

Postcard from a photograph of five young men sitting outside a building labeled 704. They are all wearing suits and hats. No identification. Possibly members of the same fraternity to which Charles Meigs Sparks belonged.

did.unittitle: Charles Sparks with some fraternity brothers

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of five young men outside a building labeled 704. They are all wearing suits and hats. Two men are sitting while the other three are standing. The man standing on the left is possible Charles Meigs Sparks. Possibly a group photo of Charles with some fraternity brothers.

Postcard from a photograph of two young men sitting outside of a building. One is wearing a hat, thumbing his nose, and has an arm around the other man's shoulder. No identification. Possibly members of the same fraternity to which Charles Meigs Sparks belonged.

Postcard from a portrait of a young man in a suit and holding a hat. Pressed into the corner: Hansen's Studio 1639 Fillmore St. San Francisco. No identification. Possibly a member of the same fraternity to which Charles Meigs Sparks belonged.

Photograph of a silhouetted woman in profile, possibly Lydia Mackenzie. She is wearing a hat. Caption on front: When I was young I used to say - A very merry Christmas day! My Style has changed and now I say - God bless you all on Christmas day! Lydia Mackenzie.

relatedmaterial.p: Possibly a relative of James MacKenzie, the husband of Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

scopecontent.p: Postcard depicting a winter river scene in a small oval. There is a boarder of white flowers. Caption on front: May the New Year be a Happy one for You And happy to those whose happiness depends on Yours.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this postcard.

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a winter river scene with a house and barn by the river. The scene is enclosed in a circle at the bottom of the card. The edges are silver with a bordering mimicing the motif of aged parchment. Caption on front: Hearty New Year Wishes.

Postcard with a New Year greeting. On the left is an oval depicting a winter scene. In the scene is a small house, a woman carrying buckets, and two cows by a river. The border of white flowers. Caption on front: I Greet You in Friendship's Name - I know no deeper, better way to say that I wish You A Happy New Year.

Postcard depicting a small man wearing a wig, three cornered hat, and a purple jacket stepping out of a grandfather clock. Caption on front: I wish you a Happy New Year! I pray its course may bring A calm content-ment to your heart Life's richest offering May griefs be few, may friends be true: May hopes burst into flower, May vanished rares and an-swered prayers Lighten each passing hour.

Postcard of a winter scene on the left with a New Year's greeting on the right. In an oval, the winter scene shows a woman walking along a snow covered hill with a house in the background. The border is made up of white flowers. Caption on front: I send a Loving Thought to Greet You this New Year - May each day of it be brighter and more perfect than the last.

Postcard of a New Year's greeting. Behind the greeting are flowers and rays of sunshine. Caption on front: A Happy New Year to you Days of Shadow, days of Sun, Come and go for everyone; Dear one I would wish for thee Many Sunny years to see.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. The border consistes of a birch/aspen bark design. There is a beam at the top with pink flowers surrounding it and at the bottom is a small winter scene of a church and a couple crossing a bridge over a river. Caption on front: A Happy New Year.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. The greeting is on a background of parchment surrounded by a night winter scene. Caption on front: A Happy New Year with nothing to distress you - Every-thing to bless you.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. Above the greeting is a castle on a snowy mountainside. The border consists of wavy stripes and roses. Caption on front: A Happy New Year May Good Fortune follow you and Adversity shun you the whole year through.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. Above the greeting is a tree with decorations and some hanging garlands. The greeting is surrounded by a green striped border with holly. Caption on front: Another New Year and the same old sincere greeting Happy New Year.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. The greeting is on a background of parchment surrounded by a night winter scene. Caption on front: Happy New Year! Many Happy New Years! Each one happier than the last.

Postcard of a New Year greeting. The greeting is on a background of parchment surrounded by a night winter scene. Caption on front: May all good things pursue you! This is my New Year Greeting to you.

Handcolored postcard of a group of people standing in a city street and boarding a trolley train. Caption on front: All aboard for the Lakes! Caption on verso: For delightful lake and river outings take the Coeur d'Alene electric trains at Spokane Terminal, Main and Lincoln Sts., Spokane. Liberty Lake, Hayden Lake, Coeur d'Alene Lake and beautiful shadowy St. Joe River all afford ideal places for picnics, summer camps or daily excursions.

did.unittitle: Summer homes at Del Cardo Bay, Lake Coeur d’Alene

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a beach with coniferous trees at the edge and some cabins near the trees. Caption on front: Summer homes at Del Cardo Bay, Lake Coeur d'Alene. Caption on verso: Cozy cottages on the lake shores about Spokane are inexpensive and make delightful summer homes. Special commutation rates via Coeur d'Alene electric line.

did.unittitle: At the Coeur d’Alene Boat Club Regatta

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a rowing team in striped red and white shirts on a lake. There are other boats on the water around them. Caption on front: At the Coeur d'Alene Boat Club Regatta. Caption on verso: Boating parties afford delightful outings on Lake Coeur d'Alene. For particulars regarding launches, address Waldo G. Paine, G.P.A., Electric Terminal, Spokane. Tel. Ex. 22.

did.unittitle: Entrance to the Hotel Idaho, Coeur d’Alene

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of the entrance to a large three story building. There is a patio on the second floor with several figures dressed in white standing on it. Caption on front: Entrance to Hotel Idaho, Coeur d'Alene. Caption on verso: Located on the lake front, nearby electric railway and steamer terminals, Hotel Idaho is convenient for tourists, and an objective point for trolley, automobile and coaching parties, J. E. O'Brien, Mgr., Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.

Handcolored postcard of the St. Joe River. The shores of the river are lined with trees. Caption on front: Beautiful Shadowy St. Joe River. Caption on verso: The St. Joe River is navigable a distance of 40 miles from Lake Coeur d'Alene to St. Joe. For perfect reflections and shadow scenery this river is unsurpassed. Daily excursions to St. Joe River via C. d'A. & S. electric line and Red Collar steamers.

did.unittitle: Camping at the St. Joe River, Idaho

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of some people at a campsite on the edge of the St. Joe river. There are three people in two rowboats on the water. Caption on front: Camping on the St. Joe River, Idaho. Caption on verso: Coll nights, no mosquitoes and excellent trout, bass and perch fishing make summer camping on St. Joe River ideal. Double daily steamer service via Red Collar S. S. Line from Coeur d'Alene city. For camp locations address J. C. White, Mgr. Red Collar S. S. Line, Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.

did.unittitle: “Palousers” camping on the St. Joe River

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a group of people camping in a forest meadow. There are three pitched tents, and five people gathered around a picnic table. Caption on front: Wont you stay to breakfast? "Palousers" Camping on the St. Joe River. Caption on verso: Ideal locations for summer camps are found on the banks of the shadowy St. Joe River. Double daily steamer service to and from Coeur d'Alene connecting with electric line for Spokane. For camp locations, address J. C. White, Mgr., Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.

did.unittitle: Steamer Idaho leaving St. Joe, Idaho

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a steamboat on a river. There is a rowboat in the foreground. Caption on the front: Steamer Idaho leaving St. Joe, Idaho. Caption on the verso: During the summer months round trips from Spokane to head of navigation on the St. Joe River are run by the Coeur d'Alene Electric Railway and the Red Collar S. S. Line. The trip by rail and water is 200 miles and affords magnificant scenery.

did.unittitle: St. Petersburg, Fla. Residence Hon. Joseph C. Sibley

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of several buildings. The one on the right has an American flag out front, the one in the middle has a belltower behind it, and the third has a two story porch. Caption on front: St. Petersburg, Fla. Residence Hon. Joseph C. Sibley.
Handcolored postcard of two orange pickers in an orange grove. One is standing by crates of oranges and the other is at the top of a ladder. Caption on front: In a Florida Orange Grove.

did.unittitle: Women’s building – Southwestern University, Georgetown, Tex.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a three story brick building with a large field in front of it. Caption on front: Women's building - Southwestern University, Georgetown, Tex.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this photograph.

did.unittitle: Cody Memorial Library, Southwestern University, Georgetown, Tex.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a three story building with several trees in front of it. Caption on front: Cody Memorial Library - Southwestern University Georgetown, Tex.

Postcard from a photograph of a large two story brick building with a bush in front. There is a sidewalk leading to the entrance of the building. Caption on front: Georgetown High School Georgetown, Tex.
Postcard from a photograph of a tall brick building with an ornate lintel over the main entrance. Caption on front: U.S. Post Office Georgetown, Tex.
Postcard from a photograph of a large road. There are some trees in the distance on either side of the road. Caption on front: Highway Bridge Georgetown, Tex.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this postcard. Copy 2 - Handwritten on verso in pencil: Benton please save this card it is a photo of my fathers old home. Urrand(?) Mother. Handwritten on verso in ink: This is looking across the two bridges crossing the north south Gabriel rivers. Grandpa's place on left between the rivers.

did.unittitle: Williamson County Court House, Georgetown, Tex.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a three story building with a rotunda on top. Caption on front: Williamson County Court House Georgetown, Tex.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this postcard. Copy 2 - Handwritten on verso: B 3112 Windsor Rd./Horrison Wilson Co. Dial 2-9841/ 22 floro Eisell halt bldg /x H Brushes Co. Corner of Colorado & 7th street/ Preston and Dyke/305 W 11th St. Dial 8-1242. [There is also a series of numbers:] 3.50, 4.10, 5.30, 6.20.

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a large hotel in a city. Caption on front: Hotel Adolphus Dallas, Texas. Caption on verso: 825 rooms with bath, 300 fully air-conditioned. Rates from $2.50 per day. Home of the popular Century Room. H. Fuller Stevens Managing Director.

did.unittitle: Galveston, The Treasure Island, “Playground of Texas”

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of seven planes flying over the shore of a large city with a couple piers in the water. Caption on front: Galveston, The Treasure Island, "Playground of Texas."

did.unittitle: In the Surf along the Beach Front, Galveston, Texas

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a beach near a city scape. There are people playing in the water and on the beach. Caption on front: In the Surf along the Beach Front, Galveston, Texas.

did.unittitle: Pioneer Life in Honey Lake Valley, Cal.

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a pioneer standing next to a covered wagon without the canvas covering. Captions on front: Pioneer life in honey lake valley, Cal.; Chuck Wagon and Cook.

Postcard of a sepia tinted drawing of a single story building with a hill in the background. Captions on front: Geo. D. Shearer & Co. Real Estate Agents Opp. Union Depot San Rafael, Cal.; 1491 - Mission San Rafael Arcangel, founded 1817, San Rafael, California.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this postcard. Copy 1 - Handwritten on verso: 226 $20.00.

did.unittitle: On the shore at Liberty Lake

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of some people fishing and sitting by the shore of a lake. In the foreground is a pitched tent. Caption on front: On the shore at Liberty Lake. Caption on verso: Nature has provided an ideal place at Liberty Lake for family outings, picnics and summer camps. Frequent trains to the lake via Coeur d'Alene electric line.

Handcolored postcard of recreational activities on a lake shore. Some people are swimming and others are preparing a row boat. Caption on front: Liberty Lake - Spokane's bathing resort. Caption on verso: Of easy access, via electric line, Liberty Lake is a delightful place for family and school picnics. Boating, bathing and fishing.

Handcolored postcard of cabins on top of a ridge overlooking a lake. Ther are a couple boats on the lake. Caption on front: Beautiful Hayden Lake, Idaho. Caption on verso: Summer cottages among the pines at Haden Lake can be rented for family use. Apply at the hotel on the grounds or Terminal Bldg. Spokanes. Special commutation rates for summer residents via Coeur d'Alene electric line from Spokane.

Handcolored postcard of a view looking over a lake with coniferous trees around the edges. Caption on front: Beautiful Haden Lake, Idaho. Caption on verso: Hayden Lake, a Washington and Idaho resort east of Spokane, is reached by the Coeur d'Alene electric line. Golf, tennis, boating, bathing and excellent trout fishing.

did.unittitle: Factories of the Firestone Tire & Rubber oc., Akron, O., U.S.A.

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a large four story building with a smoke stack. There is another inset image of another large factory building labeled "Rim Plant." Captions of this front: Factories of the Firestone Tire & Rubber Co., Akron, O., U.S.A.; New plant - Largest tire building in the world.
Handcolored postcard of a stack of rocks. There are some dead tree trunks around the pile. Caption on front: Balanced Rock, Sherman Hill, Wyoming.
Postcard from a photograph of mining buildings. There are two snow covered roads diverging from where the photo was taken.
Photograph of Crater Lake. Caption on verso: Crater Lake Discovered by John Wesley Hillman in 1853, this beautiful lake has since come to be known as one of the outstanding wonders of scenic beauty.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a large three story lodge. Caption on verso: Crater Lake - The Lodge, Located on the rim of beautiful Crater Lake, the Lodge is a luxurious and comfortable resting place for travelers.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a view of Crater Lake with a boy in a yllow shirt and blue background in the foreground. Caption on verso: Wizard Island from Lookout Point, Composed of cinders, Wizard Island rises nearly 800 feet above the rich blue of Crater Lake. Within its cone is a 90-ft crater whose circumference is over a thousand feet.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a large island in a lake. There is a boat in the foreground. Caption on front: The Phantom Ship, Crater Lake National Park, Towering more than 165 feet above Crater Lake's blue, the Phantom Ship, formed by the volcano whose erruption created the Lake, serenely withstands the centuries.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Crater Lake. Caption on verso: Crater Lake Within Wizard Island is a deep volcanic crater more than 1000 feet in circumference. Towering vari-colored cliffs contrast with the deep blue of the Lake.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Crater Lake with Wizard Island in the middle ground and a coniferous tree in the foreground. Caption on verso: Crater Lake, Its almost freezing water, harboring rainbow trout and silverside salmon, Crater Lake's dramatic blue contrasts with the multicolored cliffs which surround it.

relatedmaterial.p: Was stored in a yellow folding envelope with the caption on the front: Mike Roberts Crater Lake in Color, 6 views, Reproduced from Kodachromes/color productions. Photograph has been resleeved and rehoused.

scopecontent.p: Group of photographs. On the front of the envelope is written: Seeing Excelsior Springs, MO. The Great Health Resort of the Year. On the back of the envelope: Souvenir of Excelsior Springs, Mo. Addressed to: Miss Helen Howard, Cambridge, Webr. Photographs are double sided and attached to each other. Partial list of titles of photographs: Elms Hotel, Fire-Proof; Hotel Royal; The Snapps Hotel; Hotel Plaza; Omaha House and Salt Sea Springs; View of Sulpho Saline and Siloam Springs and Excelsior Hotel; Crystal Lithia Springs; LIthiated Soda Spring, Excelsior Spring, MO.

relatedmaterial.p: Stored in one brown envelope. Full list of titles: Elms Hotel, Fire-Proof; Hotel Royal; The Snapps Hotel; Hotel Plaza; Omaha House and Salt Sea Springs; View of Sulpho Saline and Siloam Springs and Excelsior Hotel; Crystal Lithia Springs; LIthiated Soda Spring, Excelsior Spring, MO.; Sanford House, Excelsior Spring, MO.; Hotel Nebraska, Corner of Main and South Streets; Avalon Apartments; The Pickwick Apartments; Anderson Flats and Cottage; Siloam Springs; Lithia No. 1, Excelsior Springs, MO.; Regent Spring, Excelsior Springs, MO.; Natrona Soda Spring, Excelsior Springs, MO.; Siloam Bath House; Salt Sulphur Bath House; Golf Links looking Toward Club House; Night Scene, Marietta Street, Excelsior Springs, MO.; Salt Sulphur Spring, Excelsior Springs, MO.

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a city street. Caption on front: Lion Hotel Shrewsbury. Caption on verso: The Lion at Shrewsbury, was the house of the famous Lawrence who procured the opening of the Holyhead road. It was visited by Dickens and by De Quincey.
Postcard of a photograph of an empty room with a large fireplace in the wall. Caption on front: Old fire place, Shrewsbury Castle.
Handcolored postcard of a busy city street with townhouses on both sides. Caption on front: Wyle Cop, Shewsbury.

relatedmaterial.p: Same image negative used as for photograph 00915.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a busy city street with townshouses on both sides. Caption on front: Wyle Cop, Shrewsbury.

relatedmaterial.p: Same image negative used as for photograph 00914.

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a man sitting in a room. His writs are chained to the wall. Captions on front: The British Convict Ship "Success" oldest ship afloat launched at Moulmein, Burmah 1790; The dreaded black hole where hundreds died.

scopecontent.p: Handcolored postcard of a group of people standing around a fountain. Caption on front: Bad Orb. Inneres der Phillips-Quelle.
Handcolored postcard of four men standing in bullfighting uniforms outside of a stadium. Caption on front: Bull Fighters, Tia Juana, Mexico.

did.unittitle: Boy and girl, Typical Mexican Views

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a boy and girl. The boy is wearing a sombrero, green shirt, purple belt, and white pants. The girl is wearing a white and blue top, blue belt, and a pink skirt. Both are carrying baskets of pink flowers. Caption on back: Mexico Tipico. Typical Mexican Views.

did.unittitle: Boy and girl, Typical Mexican Views

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a boy and girl facing each other. The boy is wearing a gray sombrero and a blue suit. He is holding a light pink blanket. The girl is wearing a white and blue top, a red and green skirt, and is holding a pink shawl in her arms. Caption on back: Mexico Tipico. Typical Mexican Views.

did.unittitle: Boy and girl, Typical Mexican Views

scopecontent.p: Postcard of a drawing of a boy and girl facing each other. The boy is wearing a yellow sombrero, green shirt, and white pants. The girl is wearing a blue shirt, pink skirt, and a blue and white shawl over her head. She is holding some red flowers in her hands. Caption on back: Mexico Tipico. Typical Mexican Views.

did.unittitle: Reno home of Benton H. and Ada Sparks

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a 2 story house. There is an elevated front porch. Handwritten on verso: 549 Bell Street. Reno home of Benton & Ada Sparks (3 BR kitchen & dining room & sitting room).

Postcard from a photograph of a large five story lodge with stone columns and faces. There is a field in front of the lodge with two elk laying in the grass. Caption on front: The Ahwahnee-Yosemete National Park. Handwritten on verso: July 19, 1928 Dear Ben, Got here yesterday.

did.unittitle: Beach Looking East – Long Beach, Cal.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a beach with a lot of people enjoying the shore front. In the foreground is a covered children's playground. Caption on front: Beach looking east Long Beach Cal. Handwritten on front: Have spent a few days and nights out here this summer - found the water fine! Handwritten on verso: Dear Charlie, I received your card about five weeks ago. Was glad to hear from you. I found Jack's trunk at the Van Nuyo hotel O.K. and have it in my keeping until Jack's return from N.Y. where he now is. Will be very glad to see you if you come down here you will find me at the same address. Best wishes, from Ethel.

did.unittitle: Laura Campbell in front of a house, Mineral Wells, Texas

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a woman standing in front of a single story house. There are trees and bushes in front of the house. Handwritten on front in pencil: Mrs. Laura Campbell Mineral wells Texas (Aunt Laura). Handwritten on front in ink: Aunt Laura Mother's winter (?). Handwritten on verso: I am sending you each a little kodac picture of our home. I am standing on the lawn but the picture is so dim you would not recognize it if I didn't tell you. I have not had any pictures made since I saw you last. Addressed to: Mrs. Columbia Dickerman Cornelius Oregon.

did.unittitle: Hodgin Hall, University of New Mexico, Albuquerque

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a photograph of a stucco building with a staircase on the outside. Caption on front: "Steps to Knowledge" - Hodgin Hall University of New Mexico - Albuquerque, N. M. Handwritten on verso: 8/13 Dear Auntie Maud. Should have written you sooner. Had a very busy summer at Berkeley again, & now am visiting a friend in New Mexico. Then I will stop in southern Calif for a few days, & would like to stop on my way back home wiht you for a few days, sometime around the 27th or 28th. If this is not convenient, write to me c/o Madelon Carper 1074 E. 2nd St. Long Beach. I'll let you know more later. Love Nancy. Addresed to Mrs. Maud Mackenzie Box 693, Carmel Calif.

Postcard from a formal portrait of Maud (Sparks) Mackenzie and her husband, Jim Mackenzie. Maud is wearing a white dress and hat with a dark colored fur shawl around her upper arms. Jim is wearing a pinstripe suite and tie.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this photograph. Copy 1 - Handwritten on verso: Maud & Jim Mackenzie. Copy 2 - Handwritten on verso: on left/daughter of Gov Sparks Maude Sparks McKenzie (Scribble) James McKenzie husband of Maude.

did.unittitle: Maud and John Sparks, son of Benton H. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a portrait of Maude Sparks MacKenzie and John Sparks, son of Benton and Ada Sparks. Maud is wearing a three cornered hat, a full length trench coat, and is holding an umbrella. John is wearing a uniform with a cap. He has his right arm resting on a small wooden fence.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this postcard. Copy 1 - Handwritten on verso: Maud & John.

scopecontent.p: Postcard from a cyanotype photograph of John, Charles, and Elnora Sparks standing on the front porch of the Sparks family home in Reno. John is holding the lead to a small ram and there is a dog laying in front of the small ram. Handwritten on verso: Virginia City, Nov. 8, 1907 Dear Governor, What do you think of Tom as a poser? Sincerely, John. Addressed to Gov. John Sparks, Carson City, Nevada.

relatedmaterial.p: Postcard was stored in an envelope with the following caption: Postcard written by John Durham a contemporary of Charles. He later became a justice of the peace or a judge in Reno. The picture is of Charles, Gov. John & Elnore Sparks on the front porch of the family home on S. Virginia St. Reno.

did.unittitle: View of Valley from Inspiration Point, Yosemite National Park

scopecontent.p: Handcolored photograph of a wide canyon with the floor covered in trees. Caption on verso: Yosemite National Park, Calilfornia view of the valley from Inspiration Point, Wawona Road. Daily, crowds gather at this designated parking area, to view one of hte most commanding and thrilling panoramas of the scenic grandeur of Yosemite. Handwritten on verso: Hi Papi - This is certainly a lovely place. Hope we can come here together sometime. Love, Mick. Addressed to Mr. L. J. Sparks 276 25th Ave. San Francisco, Calif.

Postcard from a photograph of a single story building arcoss a river. Thre are some bare trees in front of the building. Handwritten on front: One of my Aiceumg(?) Days at Derby school-house. Handwritten on verso: Derby, Dec. 31, 1908 A happy and successful New Year to all the Sparks family. May the joy and successes of this year influence the peace and happiness for many years to come. I returned to Raching(?) last Monday and found just as pleasant as ever. Tell Charles I have a picture of he and myself Will bring it out some day when in Reno. Best wishes, Cecyl Alteu.
Postcard from a photograph of a horse with a saddle and reins standing in front of the side of a house. Handwritten on verso: this is Jack.

did.unittitle: Leland Jr. and Nancy Lee Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Jr. and Nancy Lee Sparks posing on a sidewalk with townhouses in the background. Leland is wearing jeans and a sweater, Nancy is wearing her Navy uniform. Caption on page: "12" in April 1945. Caption under image: Leland & me.

relatedmaterial.p: Located in an album belonging to Nancy Sparks, the daughter of Leland Sparks Sr. The album has a light brown cover with four gold lines on the left side of the album cover. The leaves of the album have been unscrewed from the cover and left in original order. This album page was ripped and rejoined with the missing section.

scopecontent.p: Tintype portrait of John Sparks. He is wearing a suit and tie, a hat, and is resting his left hand on an upright book.

did.unittitle: Sarah Deal Sparks, John Sparks’ mother

scopecontent.p: Tintype portrait of Sara Deal Sparks, John Sparks' mother. She is wearing a dark colored dress and sitting in front of a mountain background. Written label (unknown source): John Sparks mother.

did.unittitle: John Sparks, Charles Sparks, and an unidentified man

scopecontent.p: Tintype portrait of John Sparks, Charles Sparks, and an unknown gentleman. John Sparks and the gentleman are seated with Charles standing in between them. The tintype is encased in a paper frame envelope. Written label (unknown source): Gov Spks left Charlie middle c1900.
Tintype portrait of John Sparks looking to the right of the camera. The photo is encased in a two-fold cardboard envelope. Written label (unknown source): Sparks unknown which one poss. John c. 1900.

did.unittitle: Four women and a man standing in a field

scopecontent.p: Tintype of four women and one man standing in a field. The women in front (one standing and one kneeling) are both holding dogs. The woman in front on the left has had her face scratched out. The tintype is encased in a light gray cardboard frame. The man is possibly Alfred Sparks. Written label (unknown source): Knight Family Maybe Maude scratched out Nora's photo c. 1880 or before. [seems to be incorrect. The people in the photo are possibly Maud Sparks with friends.]

relatedmaterial.p: There are three copies of this tintype.

scopecontent.p: Tintype portrait of a chihuahua sitting on a small platform. The dog is one of the dogs from photo 00944 of this collection. Tintype is encased in a light gray cardboard frame.

Tintype portrait of a chihuahua being held by an unidentified man (who is in photo 00944). The dog is one of the dogs from photo 00944 of this collection. Tintype is encased in a light gray cardboard frame.

relatedmaterial.p: There are two copies of this tintype.

scopecontent.p: Tintype portrait of John Sparks sitting. He is wearing a pinstripe vest and jacket.

Tintype portrait of John Sparks and possibly his brother Thomas Sparks. They are sitting in chairs wearing suits and holding revolvers pointed at each other. The tintype is encased in a copper-colored metal frame with a floral pattern.

Tintype of A. Houston, a cousin of Nancy Elnora and Rachel Knight, the wives of John Sparks. He standing in a suit and tie with his hand resting on a chair. The tintype is encased with a ripped paper frame. Handwritten on verso: Cousin of mother A. Houston.

Tintype of an unidentified woman standing on a sidewalk. She is wearing a long thick coat, hat, and gloves, and holding a parcel. Tintype is encased in a green cardboard frame with the caption "Yours Forever From" at the top.
Tintype portrait of Nancy Elnora Knight sitting. She is wearing a dark colored dress.

Tintype of two women sitting and talking to each other. The woman on the right is most likely Maud Sparks. Both women are wearing long dresses and white hats. The tintype was encased in a light pink paper frame, but the tintype had separated from the frame.

Tintype of two women sitting for a portrait. The woman on the right is most likely Maud Sparks. The woman on the left is wearing a black dress and black cap. Maud is wearing a dark colored dress with a white bow at her neck and a white hat. The tintype was encased in a light pink paper frame, but the tintype had separated from the frame.
Carte de visite portrait of Thomas Sparks, John Spark's Brother. Handwritten on verso: 1868 Jany 25 Broadway St. Louis Mo. Written label (unknown source): unknown in Houston batch.
Carte de visite portrait of Ben Knight, brother-in-law to John Sparks. Handwritten on verso: Your uncle Ben Knight. Written label (unknown source): unknown in Houston batch.

Carte de visite portrait of Newton Houston with his sons James and Perry Houston. Handwritten on verso: Uncle Newt with James and Perry Houston. Written label (unknown source): Houston family Cousin of DF Knight.

scopecontent.p: Carte de visite portrait of three girls from the Houston family wearing dresses sitting. Handwritten on verso: Houstons Nieces - of mothers Have forgotten which ones. Written label (unknown source): Houston Family Cousin of DF Knight.

Carte de visite portrait of A. Houston. Handwritten on verso: Cousin of mother's A. Houston. Written label (unknown source): A. Houston.
Carte de visite portrait of Brigham Young Jr. Handwritten on verso: Brigham Young Jr. Photographer: C. R. Savage. Written label (unknown source): Brig Young Jr.
Carte de visite portrait of Sam Houston near the end of his life. He is wearing a thick coat and holding a cane. Handwritten on verso: Sam Houston. Written label (unknown source): Sam Houston.

Cabinet card portrait of Maud Sparks about 1 year old. She is wearing a white dress and has her hair curled in ringlets. Handwritten on front: VB. Photographer: D. D. Dare.
Cabinet card portrait of Maud Sparks about 4 years old. She is wearing a white dress and leaning against a table covered with a floral blanket.

scopecontent.p: Group of three photographs depicting Charles Meigs Sparks with three of his classmates. In the top photo, the four men are looking at the camera. In the bottom photo, Charles is looking at the man next to him while the bottom row is looking at the camera.

Group of three photographs of a long haired daschund. In the top photo, the dog is sitting on a pedestal. In the middle photo, the dog is sitting with its front paws in the air looking to the side of the camera. In the bottom photo, the dog is sitting with its front paws in the air looking at the camera.

Portrait of Lillian Moore. She is wearing a white dress with a lacy shawl. Handwritten on verso: Lillian Moore - Painter.

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of Allie Burwitz and Jessie Dickerson. There are two photos present: one where Allie and Jessie are holding and another where Jessie is holding a candy for Allie to eat. Handwritten on front: Allie Me Me Allie (underneath the girls in the photo). Handwritten on verso: Allie Burwitz Sparks +2 yrs old Jessie Dickerson 4 yrs old. Our mothers' were twins. My mother's name Columbia Houston Allie's mothers name America Minerva Houstin. Cousins. Photographer: O. M. Hofsteater.

Photograph of Allie Myrtle Burwitz and her friend Margie Ostrand. They are standing beside a house holding bicycles. Handwritten on verso: Allie Myrtle Burwitz w/ friend Margie Ostrand near Cornelius.

Postcard of a single story house in Carmel, California. There are a lot of small trees and bushes surrounding the house. Handwritten on verso: Aunty Mauds house in Carmel The old house is of probable Spanish or Mexican origin.

Photograph of a white cat sitting. There is a staircase behind it with a bowl on the bottom step. Handwritten on verso: Auntie Mauds house & cat.
Photograph of a white cat sitting next to a white flower. Behind the cat is a glass door and some plants. Handwritten on verso: Auntie Mauds house & cat.

Photograph of a white cat sitting next to a white flower. The cat is staring at the flower. Behind the cat is a glass door and some plants. Handwritten on verso: One of Aunty Mauds cats on patio of old Spanish house, Carmel, Calif.
Photograph of Carmel, California, shoreline and town. Stamped on verso: Photographed by: Lewis Josselyn Carmel, California.
Photograph of a beach in Carmel, California. Most likely taken from Maud Sparks MacKenzie's house in Carmel. Handwritten on verso: A better view of Trixie & Jim McKenzie.

did.unittitle: Sparks family outside of the Alamo ranch house

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks and his family outside their family home in Reno. In the back row: Benton, Maud, and Leland Sparks. In the front row: Charles, Nancy Elnora, and John Sparks. John is holding a dog in one of his arms. Handwritten on verso: Back Row (L to R) Benton H. Sparks Maud Sparks Leland John Sparks (Sr). Front Row (L to R) Charles Meigs Sparks, Nancy Elnora Sparks, John Sparks. [the first four names are bracketed with "children," the last two names are bracketed with "mother & father"] Taken at the Alamo Stock Farm (Family Home) on S. Virginia St. Reno Nevada.

Photograph of a Sparks hunting party. John Sparks is second from the left, Charles Sparks is second from the right, and Benton Sparks is to the left of Charles. Handwritten on verso: A Sparks hunting party. Far left: Webster Darsey, Elko & S. F. attorney/next: John Sparks/3rd from left: Dr. Huntington, S.P.R.R. physician from S. F./ Center (holding pan): Jeff,the cook/2 boys at right: Benton and Charles Sparks/Far right: A Los Angeles photographer named Studebaker.
Photograph of five men on horseback. The man on the far left is holding a rifle. Handwritten on verso: Five of a larger hunting party, starting out for the hunt. John Sparks, far right.

Photograph of a group of men standing next to a wagon and in front of a log cabin. The cook, Jeff, is in the center and John Sparks is squatting down on the right with Benton in front of him. Handwritten on verso: A "John Sparks" hunting party. Mr. Sparks is squatting down (near right front) with his son Benton in front of him.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee sitting on the front lawn of the family home with Leland Jr. Sparks hugging her. Handwritten on verso: Leland Berkeley.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee kneeling in the front yard holding Leland Jr. on her knee. Leland is laughing. Handwritten on verso: Leland Berkeley. She surely loved her little brother - still does - lots.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photographic print of Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks standing in front of some plants. Nancy Lee is wearing a dress with a cap and Leland is wearing a dark coat with a cap. Handwritten on verso: Nancy Lee Leland.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks with their arms around each others' shoulders. There is a fence in the background. Handwritten on verso: Snook & Sunny.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks on a path in a backyard. Nancy has her arms on Leland's arm and shoulder. Handwritten on verso: 1939 or 40.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. Sparks in uniform

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee Sparks and Leland Sparks Jr. in their Navy uniforms. Handwritten on verso: Leland John Sparks Sr., Nancy Lee Sparks Brother & sister. The caption on the back has incorrectly labeled Leland Jr. as Leland Sr.

did.unittitle: Patricia Clarkin, Leland Sparks Jr., best man, and maid of honor

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. and Patricia Clarkin Sparks on their wedding day. They are standing between the best man and maid of honor and kissing. Handwritten on verso: Lee/Patty Sparks Wed day.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. as a baby in a play pen on a sidewalk. Handwritten on verso: Leland 533 Coventry Berkelely. Taken in Berkeley, California.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. as a baby sleeping in a playpen with a doll next to him. Handwritten on verso: This was taken three or four months ago. He was about 14 months. Leland Berkeley.

Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. holding something in his hands standing on a sidewalk. Behind him is a car parked on a street. Handwritten on verso: Coventry Rd. Berkeley. This is really a pretty good picture of Sonny. Forrest took it one day. Bet. 25 & 26 mo. old. Duranceau - Hattirose husband.

did.unittitle: Buddy, Nancy Lee Sparks, Leland Jr. Sparks, and Jane Millite

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four kids on tricycles on a sidewalk. There is a girl on a tricycle on the right, Nancy Lee and Leland Jr. on a tricycle in the middle, and there is a boy on a tricycle on the left. Handwritten on verso: The kiddies on the middle kiddie kar are Nancy Lee and "Sonny Jim" (Leland Jr.). Jane Millite & "Buddy" (?).

did.unittitle: Leland Sr. with his family, mother, and mother-in-law

scopecontent.p: Photograph of (l to r): America Burwitz, Allie Sparks, Nancy Lee Sparks, Leland Jr. Leland Sr., and Nancy Elnora Sparks. They are standing in front of a tree. Handwritten on verso: Lelands 4th birthday. Left to rite his Grandma Burwitz, Mother, Nancy L., Daddy, Grandma Sparks. Leland Jr. in front.
Photograph of two boys sitting on a sidewalk petting a dog. There is a scooter next to them. Leland Jr. is on the right. Handwritten on verso: Leland & Forrest.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. He is standing in front of a fence wearing a button up shirt and long pants. Handwritten on verso: Leland.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. standing in fornt of a house's windows next to some plants. He is wearing a button down shirt and long dark pants. Handwritten on verso: Leland.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. standing on a path in front of a fence. He is wearing a flannel shirt and long dark pants. Handwritten on verso: 13-14 130 or 1940.

did.unittitle: Leland Sparks Jr. at Pikes Peak

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. standing next to a sign for Pikes Peak Medical Research Facility. He is wearing a thick coat, gloves, and hat, and has his arms wrapped around himself. Handwritten on verso: 5-'87 Dad at Pikes Peak.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. sitting in front of a Christmas tree wearing a dark blue button up. Handwritten on verso: L. J. Sparks 12/2011.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. sitting in front of a Christmas tree wearing a brown cardigan. Handwritten on verso: L. J. Sparks 12/2/2012.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four members of the Sparks family (descendents of Leland Sparks Sr.) in front of a grapevine at a family reunion. The woman on the front right is Patricia Clarkin Sparks. Handwritten on verso: Patty Cal. 2.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two members of the Sparks family, Mike & Lori, sitting in front of a grapevine at a family reunion. Handwritten on verso: Mike & Lori Family Reunion 1985.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four members of the Sparks family in front of a grapevine at a family reunion. There is a mother and father sitting in lawn chairs with their son and daughter standing behind them. Handwritten on verso: Agnes 2. A #23.

relatedmaterial.p: The couple sitting in this photo are also in photograph 01197.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man and woman sitting in lawn chairs in front of a grapevine at a Sparks family reunion. Handwritten on verso: Dolores, Aunt Agnes 2, Diane, Kathy. C #23.

relatedmaterial.p: The couple sitting in this photo are also in photograph 01196.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Patricia Sparks, Tony Sparks, and Jo sitting in front of a grapevine at a family reunion. Patricia and Jo are looking at Tony. Handwritten on verso: Tony, Jo. [f]amily reunion 1985.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

separatedmaterial.p: Photograph of a man with a boy on his lap and Lori sitting in front of a grapevine at a Sparks family reunion. Handwritten on verso: Dolores, Aunt Agnes 2, Diane, Kathy, Patty An Cal. 2. A #27.

did.unittitle: Members of the Sparks family at a reunion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. and Patricia Sparks sitting in front of a grapevine at the Sparks family reunion. Handwritten on verso: Lee & Patty Sparks Family Reunion 7-'85.
Polaroid of Diane Sparks and Leland Sparks Jr. standing on a front lawn. Caption on front: Diane & Dad: c August '02.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. standing in a kitchen with a couple other unidentifiable people. Handwritten on verso: Auntie Pat.

Photograph of two African American girls standing next to some buckets between wooden farm buildings. Handwritten on verso [very uncertain on handwriting]: Daisey corastew - Ouyter ridges" Georgetown Texas.
Photograph of a grove of trees with a fence running underneath. There are two people under the trees. No identification. Handwritten on verso: Brushy grove.

did.unittitle: House and field in Georgetown, Texas

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a single story house with a large field in front of it. Handwritten on verso: Auto Count. Between N. & South Gabriel - Old place. Most likely taken in Georgetown, Texas.
Photograph of a river with trees on the banks. Handwritten on verso: East side S. Gabriel. Most likely taken in Georgetown, Texas.
Photograph of a river with trees on the banks. Handwritten on verso: East side N. Gabriel at old place -. Most likely taken in Georgetown, Texas.

did.unittitle: House with a field in the foreground, Georgetown, Texas

scopecontent.p: Photograph of railroad track in a field. In the background are white single story houses against the trees. Handwritten on verso: Down triangle Home Place.
Photograph of plants in a field near a railroad track. In the background are white single-story. Handwritten on verso: Triangle.
Photograph of the Golden Gate Bridge. Caption on verso: The Golden Gate Bridge from Land's End, San Francisco.

Photograph of a monument to Rachel Sparks, John Sparks' first wife, in Georgetown Cemetery. The monument is behind a fence. Handwritten on verso: In Georgetown Cemetery Monument to Rachel, John Spark's John Sparks' first wife.
Photograph of a grove of trees at the edge of a field. Handwritten on verso: Home place old cellg.

did.unittitle: Trees on the other side of a road

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a road with trees in a field behind it. There is a sign at the edge of the road labeled "Modern Cabins." Handwritten on verso: Home trees.
Photograph of a field with trees in the middle ground. On the front right is a flimsy pole. Handwritten on verso: Home trees.
Photograph of a large tent with firewood near the entrance flap of the tent and other camping supplies around the tent. Handwritten on verso: Our camp at Napa Valley Ranch Club 1959.
Photograph of a single story with a fence around it and a hill rising behind it. Caption on front: Mar. 60. Handwritten on verso: #140 Angels Camp.

did.unittitle: Stream by the Sparks Alamo ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a stream with rocks on one bank and trees on the other bank. Most likely taken near John Sparks' ranch in Reno, Nevada. Handwritten on verso: 1/2 way back at the ranch.

did.unittitle: Men sitting in a wagon at a Sparks ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a wagon with four men sitting in it being drawn by two horses. There are two men standing behind the wagon and a house in the background. Handwritten on verso: One of the several rigs on the Sparks ranch at the disposal of the host's guests for his hunting parties. In the rear is the old "HD" ranch house, a ranch originally owned by Tom Hubbard & bought by Sparks.
Photograph of the Sparks ranch cook, Jeff, standing with his hand outstretched next to a dog. Handwritten on verso: "Jeff," the cook on the Sparks ranch.

Photograph of a two story stone building with some trees in front. There is a chicken walking in the yard. Most likely Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock stage coach house & store - old bridge.
Photograph of a patch of land next to a slope with some farm building at the top of the slope. Most likely taken in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock.
Photograph of a small house with a telephone pole in front of it. In front of the house is a road. Most likely taken in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock.

Photograph of a single story stone house with a stone wall in front of it. There is a road that runs in front of the house and passes a railroad crossing. Most likely taken in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock.
Photograph of a two story building with a small fence in front of it. The second story has a covered balcony. Most likely taken in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock Stage lodgeings.

Photograph of a two story ranch house in Round Rock, Texas. There is a small shed next to the house with a car parked in front of it. In the foreground is a fence. Handwritten on verso: best of Round Rock Texas. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.

Photograph of a field with bushes and trees obscuring most of the view of ranch buildings in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock Texas. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.

Photograph of a two story ranch house with a wind turbine behind it in Round Rock, Texas. There is a patch of cacti in the foreground and a car parked on the right. Handwritten on verso: Best of Round Rock Texas. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.

Photograph of a single story ranch house in Round Rock, Texas. There is a wind turbine behind the house. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock, Texas. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.

Photograph of a single story stone house with a stone wall in front of it. There is a road that runs in front of the house and passes a railroad crossing. Taken in Round Rock, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock - Texas. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.

relatedmaterial.p: Same house as in photograph 01223.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the Round Rock Store. The store is single story with a wind turbine and trees behind it. To the right of the store a car is parked. Written on the side of the store: G. F. Smothers Staple & Fancy Groceries. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock - store.

Photograph of a little girl holding a black lab puppy in her front yard. The shadow of the woman taking the photograph is visible in the picture. Handwritten on verso: 1963. This is Smiroff when we first got her.

did.unittitle: Family sitting on a front porch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three women, one man, two boys, and one girl sitting on a front porch. Handwritten on verso: Aunt Jodie, Rex, Aunt Rachel and three children. Grandma N.

did.unittitle: Daisy and Emma in front of a car

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two women standing in front of a car. There are telephone poles in the background. Handwritten on verso: Daisy & Emma. Georgetown, Tex of depistun (?) - rusting. Photograph processed by Ward's Camera Shop on Nov. 10, 1941.
Photograph of Webster Darsey standing in front of a saddled horse and wagons. He is holding a rifle in his hand. Handwritten on verso: Webster Darsey in 1896, at Lost Creek.

did.unittitle: Sparks hunting party with a deer that Webster Darsey has shot

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men from a Sparks hunting party in 1896 standing around a wagon. There is a deer suspended from the wagon. Handwritten on verso: The man at far left is Webster Darsey, a prominent attorney of Elko and San Francisco, and a frequent guest in Sparks' hunting parties. The deer handing to the chuckwagon, in preparation for being skinned, had just been shot by Webster Darsey.

Photograph of Benton Sparks on horseback in front of a log cabin and wagon during a Sparks hunting party. Handwritten on verso: Benton Sparks, 1896, at the log cabin and spring of the north lower slope of Golliher mountain, on the Sparks property (The mountain has been spelled in different ways, but the above spelling is considered to be the correct one. [with black marker]: 1978 Uncle Beenei says that this is a picture of Leland - his brother.
Photograph of a Tom Sparks (son of Leland Jr. Sparks) sitting at a table with a birthday cake in front of him. His family is surrounding him. Handwritten on verso: 1966 Tom's 15th Birthday.

did.unittitle: Dr. Huntington and Jeff at a chuckwagon

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two men standing at the chuckwagon of a Sparks hunting party. The man on the left is Dr. Huntington and the man on the right is the cook, Jeff. Handwritten on verso: Left: Dr. Huntington, S.P.R.R. doctor, having a "quick one" at the Sparks chuckwagon.

Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie standing next to a stone wall with a lighthouse and buildings in the background. Maud is wearing a dress, shawl, and cap. Handwritten on verso: Auntie Maud. Photograph processed by Bear Photo Service on April 19,1935.
Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie standing at her "Spanish" house in Carmel, California. She is surrounded by plants and has a shawl around her shoulders. Handwritten on verso: Aunti Maud.

Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie standing in front of the Carmel Post Office. She is holding a purse and wearing a dress, heavy shawl, and hat. In front of her is a small chihuahua wearing a sweater barking at her. Handwritten on verso: Auntie Maud.

did.unittitle: Maud Sparks MacKenzie and Helen Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie holding a book and Helen Sparks standing next to a stone wall. Helen Sparks is the wife of Benton K. Sparks. Handwritten on verso: L. ro R. Maud MacKenzie Helen Sparks.

did.unittitle: Leland Jr. and Patty Ann Sparks with a bunny

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. with his daughter Patricia Ann and a bunny in a backyard. Handwritten on verso: 1954 - Lee & Patty Ann.

did.unittitle: Sparks Alamo Ranch in Reno, Nevada

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the Governor's ranch house in Reno, Nevada. Behind the house are some other buildings. There are some large trees in front of the buildings. Handwritten on verso: Sparks, John (Governor) house on South Virginia St. Reno, Nevada.

relatedmaterial.p: "Label with photographs [unknown source]: Sparks Ranch in Reno (Personal Zoo) (4) Top= ""The Alamo"" house ""Sparks Mansion."" The photos were in brown mounts/mattes. The photographs were removed and resleeved. "

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three elk (two female and one male) in a pasture at "The Alamo" Sparks Ranch in Reno, Nevada.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three elk (two female and one male) in a pasture at The Sparks "Alamo" Ranch in Reno, Nevada.

relatedmaterial.p: "Label with photographs [unknown source]: Sparks Ranch in Reno (Personal Zoo) (4) Top= ""The Alamo"" house ""Sparks Mansion."" The photos were in brown mounts/mattes. The photographs were removed and resleeved. "

scopecontent.p: Photograph of The Sparks "Alamo" Ranch in Reno, Nevada. The fence in front of the ranch house is in the foreground and there are ranch buildings in the background.

relatedmaterial.p: "Label with photographs [unknown source]: Sparks Ranch in Reno (Personal Zoo) (4) Top= ""The Alamo"" house ""Sparks Mansion."" The photos were in brown mounts/mattes. The photographs were removed and resleeved. "

scopecontent.p: Photograph of six men sitting in a car. Governor John Sparks is in the front on the right.

relatedmaterial.p: Label with photograph [unknown source]: Gov Sparks (rt.) Goldfield?

did.unittitle: John Sparks with other men around a campfire

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men sitting around a campfire with some Dutch ovens around the fire. John Sparks is sitting on the far left.

did.unittitle: John Sparks with other men at a round table in an office

scopecontent.p: Photograph of seven men sitting around a round table in an office. John Sparks is sitting second from the left.
Cabinet card of John Sparks wearing a suit and bowtie. Produced by Elite Photographic Studios.
Photograph of Dr. David F. Knight wearing a suit. Handwritten on verso: Dr. D. F. Knight Father of Nora Sparks. Photograph was found in an envelope addressed to: Jno. Sparks, Georgetown Tx.

did.unittitle: Eight men standing on a hillside

scopecontent.p: Photograph of eight men in suits standing on a slope around some boulders. John Sparks is the man on the upper right.

did.unittitle: Women in “trade costumes” for a carnival in Lampasas, Texas

scopecontent.p: Photograph of twenty-four women in "trade costumes" displaying the wares of stores in Lampasas, Texas, as part of a "Trade Carnival" on Dec. 20th 1889. There is a man with a can standing in front of them. The woman eighth from the right is representing the Sparks Bros. Druggists.

did.unittitle: Monument of John Sparks with a man standing in front of it

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man looking up at the bust of John Sparks at his memorial in Reno at the Masonic Memorial Cemetery. The bust was sculpted by Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Martin Van Buren Sparks, John Sparks (son of Benton Sparks), Ben[ton] K. Sparks, Maud Sparks MacKenzie, and a woman (possibly Helen Sparks) wearing a fur coat outside of Maud's mansion in Carmel, California. Maud is holding a dog.

did.unittitle: Man and woman outside of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified man and woman sitting on chairs under an umbrella outside of Maud MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. Both are holding dogs next to them.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie in front of the bust that she carved of John Sparks for his cemetery monument. Most likely taken in her home at Carmel, California.
Portrait of Maud Mackenzie Sparks wearing a white dress.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph of 01100 is a duplicate of this image. Mounted portrait is stored in a box with cabinet cards from the collection.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four men standing on a golf green. The man second from the left is Martin van Buren Sparks.

Photograph of a woman (possibly Helen Sparks) and Maud Sparks MacKenzie standing in front of a two story building.

Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion at Carmel, California.

did.unittitle: Man in a doorway of Maud MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an indistinct man (possibly one of Benton Sparks' sons) standing in a doorway at Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California.
Photograph of an interior room, possibly a bedroom, in Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California.
Photograph of a bedroom with a fireplace with a triangular mantle. The photograph was double exposed, but it is unclear what the second exposure depicts.
Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion at Carmel, California. There is a car parked at the end of the house with an unidentified man standing in front of it.

Photograph from above of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion at Carmel, California. The ocean and beach are visible behind the mansion. A car is parked at the edge of the house and there is a ladder leaning against one of the portions of the mansion.
