scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion at Carmel, California.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph 01274 is a duplicate of this image.

scopecontent.p: Partial photograph of Maud Sparks in a dress. The lower portion has been torn off.

Cabinet card of Maud Sparks as a girl. She is wearing a skirt and striped coat, holding a hat in her right hand and the rope of a swing in her left hand. Photograph taken by Kirkland. Handwritten on front: Maud Sparks.

relatedmaterial.p: Cabinet card has been stored in a box with other cabinet cards from the collection.

scopecontent.p: Portrait of Ada Ede Sparks wearing a dress. Handwritten on frame: Mrs. Ada Sparks, Benton H. Sparks.

Glass plate of a portrait of Walter Ede wearing a suit. The plate has a red matte surrounding the portrait. The plate was attached to a metal stand. Handwritten on the backing and frame: Walter Ede - Father of Ada Ede Sparks who married Benton H. Sparks. He was a rancher in Sierra Valley Calif.
Photograph of a log cabin with a fence in front of it. One wall is made of flat boards.

did.unittitle: Men standing in the lobby of the Overland Hotel

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men sitting or standing in the lobby of the Overland Hotel. Handwritten on verso: Lobby of old Overland Hotel. Builder was Alec Dromiac (unsure of spelling) & friend of John Sparks. Mr. Dromiac asked Sparks to name the hotel & he did - OVERLAND HOTEL. in picture L to R. Charles Saddler who owned the business (but not Bldg), George Wingfield - mining millionaire (Goldfield & Tonopah), Man in middle with watch chian is Bob Perry who ran the stock yards.

did.unittitle: Dog sitting in front of a Sparks family home in Georgetown, Texas

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a dog sitting in front of a bench made out of antlers. There is a house in the background, which was the home of the Sparks family. Caption on front: old "Ed." Handwritten on verso: The old home just outside of Georgetown, Texas.

did.unittitle: Lon Moore with a flour wagon

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Lon Moore, husband of Lillian Moore, standing next to two horses hitched to a cart. The side of the cart reads Olympic Flour. Handwritten on verso: Lon Moore - Portland Flouring Mill team.

did.unittitle: Indian family appealing to Governor Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Governor John Sparks standing next to an oval table talking with a Native American interpreter while four other Native Americans sit behind Sparks. Caption on front: Indian Johnny's Father, Mother, two sisters and an Interpreter appealing to Governor Sparks to save the life of their son and brother, who was executed for the crime of murder at the Nevada State Prison December 7, 1906.

did.unittitle: Maud Sparks and a man at a Georgetown home of John Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Sparks family house in Georgetown, Texas. Maud Sparks MacKenzie is standing in the front yard next to an unidentified man. There are some decorative antler pieces in the front yard as well. Caption on front: Home of Capt. John Sparks Georgetown Tex 1896.

Photograph of Alfred Ede Sparks as a toddler. He is wearing a white garment, holding a small cup, and sitting on a small chair. Handwritten on verso: Alfred Ede Sparks. Photograph taken by Riverside Studio.

did.unittitle: Two men and two women behind a paper mill cylinder

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two men and two women standing behind a cylinder for a paper mill. The two women are looking at the camera and the men are working on the cylinder. Handwritten on verso: left to right Emma Hiff - unknow[n] and Allie [possibly Allie Burwitz]. (the men) They are repairing a cylinder in a paper mill in Bridal Veil, Oregon. Ordinarily they would have been sitting on the near side to repair it, but sat in the back for the picture.
Photograph of a portrait of John Sparks. He is wearing a checkered suit and a dark tie. Handwritten on verso: Mrs. Nora Sparks. Picture of Mrs John Sparks. Photograph was mounted by Charles Lainer.

Photograph of a profile portrait of John Sparks. He is wearing a checkered suit and a dark tie. Handwritten on verso: Mrs Nora Sparks picture of Mr John Sparks. Photograph was mounted by Charles Lainer.
Photograph of John Sparks sitting at a desk. He has a pair of glasses in his left hand and a newspaper in his right hand. Handwritten on front: Thomson 1903.

Photograph of a portrait of John Sparks wearing a suit, bowtie, and cowboy hat. Handwritten on front: Thomson 1904. Handwritten on verso: Grandpa Sparks (John Sparks) died 1908 - just under 65 years of age.

did.unittitle: Portrait of John Sparks without mustache circa 1890

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks without a mustache. He is wearing a suit, bowtie, and a long overcoat. Handwritten on verso: John Sparks - again w/out mustach. Photograph mounted by Taber.

did.unittitle: Portrait of John Sparks without mustache circa 1890

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks without a mustache. He is in profile sitting in a wooden chair wearing a suit. Handwritten on verso: Thornwall 1705 Birch. Photograph mounted by Taber.

did.unittitle: John Sparks and Captain Dave, circa 1900

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks standing next to a Native American man sitting in an antler chair. John Sparks is wearing a suit with a cowboy hat and the Native American man is wearing a suit with a badge on his left lapel. Handwritten on verso: Probably the Indian is "Captain Dave" the head man of the Washoe Tribe, with Gov. Sparks. Photograph mounted by Smith Studio.

did.unittitle: Maud Sparks MacKenzie in her wedding dress

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie in her wedding dress. She is standing with her arms crossed behind her back. Photograph was taken by Dann.

did.unittitle: Maud Sparks MacKenzie in her wedding dress

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Maud Sparks MacKenzie in her wedding dress. She is holding a bunch of daisies in her hands and looking at them. Handwritten on verso: Maud Sparks. Photograph was taken by Dann.

Photograph of Maud Sparks wearing a dress suit, blazer, and bowler cap. She is looking up at a spaniel which is sitting on a brick wall. Handwritten on verso: Maud Sparks. Photograph was taken by Dann.
Photograph of Maud Sparks wearing a dress suit, blazer, and bowler cap. She is looking down at a spaniel which is sitting on a brick wall. Photograph was taken by Dann.
Photograph of Maud Sparks wearing a dress with a knit jacket, gloves, and a decorative hat. She is standing next to a stone wall. Handwritten on verso: Maud Sparks. Photograph by Falle.
Hand tinted portrait of Maud Sparks. Handwritten on verso: Maude Sparks (MacKenzie). Photograph was taken by Taber.
Photograph of Charles Sparks wearing a suit and tie. Handwritten on verso: Charles M. Sparks. Photograph taken by the River Side Gallery.

did.unittitle: Leland Sparks Sr. with two friends

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Sr. with two unidentified men. Handwritten on front: August 1st 1908. Photographer: H. Pierre Smith.

Photograph of a group of men and women in front of an American flag. Leland Sparks Sr. is sitting in the third row fifth from the right. Charles Sparks is sitting in the center of the fourth row. Handwritten on verso: Uncle Charles Sparks seated center, in dark coat.

Photograph of a field with a canyon in the background. There is a horse facing away from the camera in the foreground. Handwritten on verso: 1 Natural reservoir site in Muddy river near Moapa Salt Lake Route, Lincoln co., Nev.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph is stored in a smaller box with similar photographs.

did.unittitle: Four men standing in a wheat field

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four men standing in a field of wheat. Handwritten on verso: 3 Field of wheat in May, sown and irrigated in Nev. Previous Sprolls Ranch, Muddy River, Lincoln Co., Nevada. Near Moapa on Salt Lake Route.

did.unittitle: Men standing next to fig trees and grape vines

scopecontent.p: Photograph of men standing next to crops and trees. Handwritten on verso: 4 Fig trees and grape vines in Major Holt's vinyard. Muddy River, Lincoln Co., Nev. Near Moapa on Salt Lake Route.
Photograph of a field of alfalfa. Handwritten on verso: 6 Alfalfa field. Cobbs ranch Overton. Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Four men in front of a fan palm tree

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four men standing in front of a fan plam. Handwritten on verso: 7 Fan palm tree at Cobbs ranch in Muddy River, Lincoln Co. Nev. near Overton.
Photograph of a field of grapevines. Handwritten on verso: 8 Prize seedless grape vineyard Mr. Gibson's ranch at St. Thomas on the Muddy River. Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Man standing next to apricot trees

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man standing next to a grove of trees. Handwritten on verso: 9 - Apricot trees, orchard on Sen. Clark's ranch. Las Vegas, Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Adobe house with trees in front

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an adobe house with trees and a fence in front of it. Handwritten on verso: 10 Old adobe house. Las Vegas ranch, Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Three men standing next to fig trees

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three men standing next to some trees. Handwritten on verso: 11 Fig trees. Sen. Clark's Las vegas ranch, Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Four men next to an apricot tree

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four men underneath a tree. Handwritten on verso: 12 Largest apricot tree in the world. Twenty years old. 18 inches in diameter. Produced one ton of fruit in one season. Sen. Clark's Las Vegas ranch Lincoln Co, Nev.

did.unittitle: Three men sitting under some trees

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three men sitting underneath some trees. Handwritten on verso: 13 Three "setters" in Las Vegas vineyard. Lincoln Co. Nev.

did.unittitle: Two men outside the Las Vegas fort

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man pointing at a brick wall with another man sitting on a tree root and writing. Handwritten on verso: 14 - The old Las Vegas fort, showing the port or rifle hole. The same being a part of the first smelter built west of the Mo. River. Erected for smelting lead ores from Potosi mine in Charleston Mt.

did.unittitle: Main street in a small town

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the main road in a town with some single story buildings on either side of the road. 15 Mr. Williams town. Las Vegas. Lincoln Co. Nev. May 1905.
Photograph of an icing station in Las Vegas. Handwritten on verso: 16 Armour ice plant for icing fruit cars (West Side) Las Vegas New on Salt Lake route.

did.unittitle: Armour icing station in Las Vegas

separatedmaterial.p: Photograph of the Armour icing station in Las Vegas. Handwritten on verso: 17 Armour's ice plant (east side) Las Vegas Nev. For icing fruit cars on Salt Lake route.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of people standing between trains. Handwritten on verso: 18 Salt Lake train at Las Vegas, Nev. May 11, 1905.
Photograph of a man in a suit and hat pointing at some buildings in the distance behind him. Handwritten on verso: 19 Truts at Las Vegas Nev. May 11 - 1905.
Photograph of some people standing around train cars. Handwritten on verso: 20 Depot car at Las Vegas Nev. May 1905.

did.unittitle: People walking between a passenger and carrier train

scopecontent.p: Photograph of men walking between two trains, one passenger and one carrier. Handwritten on verso: 21 Overland flyer Las Vegas Nev. May 1905. Salt Lake route.

did.unittitle: Some men in front of a train station

scopecontent.p: Photograph of some men standing outside a train station. Handwritten on verso: 22 Old depot Los Angeles. Salt Lake route. May 1905.

Photograph of a overpass for a road with houses and telephone poles visible at a lower level. In the foreground is the head of a man and a horse. Handwritten on verso: 24 On First St. bridge. Los Angeles, Cal.

did.unittitle: Kiowa girls in elk tooth dresses

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of two Native American girls of the Kiowa tribe wearing elk tooth dresses. One of them is sitting on a chair covered by a fur. Handwritten on verso [twice: once in pencil and once in pen]: Little Kiowa girls Elk tooth dresses Value $500.00 apiece. Photographer: Irwin.

Cabinet card of a young Native American woman of the Kiowa tribe wearing an elk tooth dress. She is posed with her hands behind her head. Handwritten on verso [twice: once in pencil and once in pen]: Kiowa Annie elk tooth dress value $1000.00.

Cabinet card of a Native American chieftan between two Native American women. They are standing on the front porch of a building. Handwritten on verso: Quanah Parker with two of his six Squaws. Chief of the Comanche Indians. Photographer: Irwin.

did.unittitle: Horse named Bonaparte with a trainer

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a horse with a horse trainer at his head holding the reins. Handwritten on verso: Pucheron Norman, "Boneparte" 7 yr. Sweepstakes Nevada State Fair Reno 9-24-90, Compliments of Fred Stadtmuller.
Photograph of ranch buildings and some fences. Handwritten on front: Hubbard Ranch.
Photograph of ranch sheds. There are horses eating at a trough in front of the shed. Handwritten on front: Saujacinto sheds.

did.unittitle: Sparks mining boat on the Snake River

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a mining boat on the Snake River belonging to the Sparks family. Handwritten on verso: Sparks Mining Boat on Snake River.

did.unittitle: Corporal James Emmett Shrigerland on horseback

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a young soldier named James Emmett Shrigerland in uniform on a horse. The soldier is holding an American Flag. Handwritten on verso: Yours Sincerely, Corporal James Emmett Shrigerland.
Photograph of a portrait of an older man. He is wearing a suit and tie. Caption attached to photograph: My friend, K. B. Armour. Photographer: D. P. Thomson.
Photograph of a portrait of an older man wearing a suit and tie. Handwritten on verso: C R Thomas [?] sec. order. Photographer: D. P. Thomson.

did.unittitle: Man and pony in a corral

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man holding the lead to a small pony. They are standing in a corral with trees in the background.

did.unittitle: Elk at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of three elk belonging to John Sparks standing next to a wooden ranch building. There is a male, female, and young elk. Their names are Billie, Kate, and Bess.

did.unittitle: Two men standing in front of a house

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a two story house with two men standing in front of it. Between the men is a dog sitting on a stool and a bird in a cage on top of a ladder. No identification.

Photograph of a single story stone house with a fence around it. There are palm trees along the road with support cages around them. There are some people standing on the front porch of the house. Handwritten on front: Our house in Burnet. Handwritten on verso: in Texas.

did.unittitle: Sparks Alamo Ranch house with John Sparks’ kids in front

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the Sparks ranch house in Reno, Nevada, with Leland Sr., Charles, and Benton in front of the fence and Nancy Elnora and an unidentified woman behind it. Handwritten on verso: another view of our Reno home with Benton, Charlie, & Leland outside the fence. From Mama.

Photograph of a man named James Williby sitting horseback. Handwritten on verso: Jas Williby worker for Jno Sparks in Wyoming & Nevada in 1878 to 1882 after which doh he joined Buffalo Bill's Wild West which Morwich Mess Laleou Sruich the famous rifle shot of the world. Photographer: Kid. Created by Kirkland studios.

did.unittitle: People standing on the porch of the Sparks Alamo Ranch house

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the Sparks ranch house in Reno, Nevada. There are two women sitting on the porch (one of whom is Nancy Elnora), two men standing in front of the porch, and two boys sitting on the steps (possibly Leland Sr. and Benton). Charles is standing in front of another man on the other side of the porch. Handwritten on verso: Front-friew of our Reno home, from Mama.

Photograph of Nancy Lee Sparks in a white dress with her mother, Allie Burwitz Sparks. Nancy Lee is sitting on a photographer's box. Handwritten on verso: Allie M. Sparks (mom) Nancy Lee Sparks (daughter).
Photograph of Nanyc Lee Sparks standing on a path next to a building and a large plant. She is wearing a simple dress.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. sitting on a tricycle in a yard. He is looking to the left. Handwritten on verso: Leland Berkeley, Coventry Rd.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. as a baby. He is sitting in a wicker baby buggy and laughing. Handwritten on verso: Nancy Lee Excuse me Leland about 6 mo - younger I guess.

Photograph of a woman named Madge MacMillian Ede with her hair pulled back in a bun. Madge Ede was married to Alfred Ede, who is the brother of Ada Ede Sparks (wife of Benton H. Sparks). She is wearing a blouse with a bow at the top. Handwritten on verso: Madge Macmillian Ede Wife of Alfred Ede the commanded the submarine F. 4. Sunk in Hawaii.

did.unittitle: John Sparks, Son of Benton H. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks (son of Benton H. Sparks) when he is two years old. He is sitting on a bench with his arms crossed. Handwritten on verso: John Sparks, Benton & Ada Sparks oldest son. Photograph taken by Riverside Studios.

did.unittitle: John Sparks, Son of Benton H. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks (son of Benton H. Sparks) when he is a baby. He is wearing a white garment and sitting. Handwritten on front: John Sparks, Benton & Ada Sparks oldest son. Photographer: F. P. Dann.

did.unittitle: Bison at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Silver gelatin of a bison standing next to a tree on the Sparks Alamo Ranch in Reno, Nevada. In the background is a square tower with glass windows at the top. Handwritten on verso: In front of "The Alamo," S. Virginia St, Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Bison at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Silver gelatin of a bison standing next to a tree on the Sparks Alamo Ranch in Reno, Nevada. In the background is a square tower with glass windows at the top. Handwritten on verso: At "The Alamo," S. Virginia St, Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Bison at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Albumen of a pony standing next to a trough in a corral. In the background is a shed. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The photograph is showing the right side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The photograph is showing the left side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The photograph is showing the right side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The bust is partially obscured by the door, but is showing the left side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The photograph is showing the right side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Silver gelatin of the bust of John Sparks carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie for his monument. The photograph is showing the left side of the bust. Most likely taken in Maud's mansion at Carmel, California. Photographer: Maud Sparks MacKenzie.
Photograph of a portrait of Leland Sparks Jr. wearing a tweed jacket. Handwritten on verso: 13-14 1930 or 40.

did.unittitle: Sparks hunting party: six men on horseback

scopecontent.p: Photograph of six men on horseback with ten dogs in front of the horses. The man third from the left is Governor John Sparks. Handwritten on verso: Gov Sparks.

Cabinet card of a Native American chieftan standing. He has a feather in his hair and a cloak wrapped around him. Handwritten on verso: Sioux Chief Spotted Tail. Cabinet card manufactured by Ellingson.

did.unittitle: Exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. There is a table with an umbrella above it and four chairs around it next to the mansion. The image was developed horizontally flipped. Handwritten on verso: Reverse.

relatedmaterial.p: This photograph is the horizontal reverse of photograph 01394.

scopecontent.p: Portrait of an unidentified woman. She is wearing a dress and scarf with her hair curled. Handwritten on verso: 704 011-3/4 Close BAB.

did.unittitle: Male elk at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a male elk, most likely belonging to John Sparks and kept at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno. Handwritten on verso: 76 Uncle Beenie said (in 1975) that this "was a mean one." Would fuck up an empty 5 gal can with his antlers & toss it up & catch it every time. And letting out a hissing sound at same time. Pic taken across rod & a little north of 'Alamo stock farm.'

Photograph of six men standing next to an open train car and one man standing on top of an oil car as part of a train. Handwritten on verso: Entrance of the first train into the Bueefreq district at Gold Center, Nevada, Oct. 7, 1906 at 3:15 pm. Gov. Sparks & part aboard. Compliments of Seals McCauley & Snead. Rhyolite, Nev.

Photograph of Allie Burwitz Sparks. She is sitting on a bench wearing a light colored shirt and pleated skirt, smiling at the camera with her body slightly turned away from the camera. Handwritten on verso: Allie Burwitz Sparks wife of Leland John Sparks Sr.
Photograph of a portrait of John Sparks clean shaven wearing a suit with a loose bowtie and an overcoat. Handwritten on verso: Mrs. J. Sparks 719 Humboldt, Reno, Nev. Bust H 5 in head.
Photograph of John Sparks without a mustache sitting in a carved wooden chair. He is wearing a suit with a loose bowtie and an overcoat.

Photograph of Charles Sparks standing in front of a fence. He is wearing a long sleeve button down shirt, chaps, a bandana around his neck, and a cowboy hat. Handwritten on verso: Uncle Charlie Son of Gov. John Sparks.

did.unittitle: Allie Sparks, America Burwitz, and Lillian Moore

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Allie Burwitz Sparks, America Burwitz, and Lillian Moore standing in front of the wall of a house. Handwritten on verso: mamma Lillian Me just before Nancy Lee was born/Left Allie Myrtle Burwitz Sparks, America Manerva Houston Burwitz, Lillian Moore - Painter.
Photographic portrait of Leland Sparks Sr. He is wearing a suit with a striped tie. Handwritten on verso: Leland John Sparks Sr.
Photograph of Martin Van Buren Sparks wearing a tweed suit and holding a tweed cap in his left hand. He is standing on a grassy field with trees in the background.
Photograph of Martin Van Buren Sparks wearing a tweed coat and a paisley tie.

did.unittitle: John Sparks with a Hereford cow

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks standing next to a cow in a corral. In the background is a fence and a barn with open sides. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch.

did.unittitle: John Sparks at his desk with an employee circa 1900

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks sitting at his desk with many ribbons and awards on the wall behind the desk. Sitting in front of John Sparks is another man, possibly an employee of Sparks. Handwritten on verso: Gov. John Sparks (right). The man on left is probably the man that Sparks sent to England to bring back pure bred cattle to stock the Alamo.

did.unittitle: John Sparks at his desk circa 1900

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks sitting at his desk with many ribbons and awards on the wall behind the desk.He is looking off into the distance with his hand resting on paper holding a fountain pen.

did.unittitle: John Sparks outside the Palace Livery Stable

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men standing outside of a stable (some are sitting on horses or donkeys). There is a sign above the stable entrance that reads: Palace Livery Stable Goldfield & Tonopah Williams & Trabert Props. First Class Turnouts. John Sparks is on the back of a donkey holding a long switch.

Photograph of a field with Hereford cattle in the field. There is one cow looking at the camera. Taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada. Handwritten on verso: Tom P. Hughes. Taken at the Alamo.

did.unittitle: John Sparks with a Hereford cow at the Alamo Ranch stables

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Hereford cow standing in front of the stables at the Sparks Alamo ranch. There is a man holding the lead to the cow and John Sparks is standing behind the cow. Handwritten on verso: Tom P. Hughes.

Photograph of a thoroughbred horse wearing a bridle. The trainer is holding the bridle. In the background is a large building and a fence. Handwritten on verso: Theodore Winter's Famous "Joe Hooker," Trainer Grant.
Photograph of a herd of Hereford cattle in a fenced field. Handwritten on verso: no 24. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Hereford cow possibly at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Hereford cow standing in a field with a ranch building behind it. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Hereford cow possibly at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Hereford cow standing in a field with trees on the other side of a fence. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Hereford cow (Lady or Miss Wilton) at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Hereford cow standing in a field near a fence. Most likley taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada. Handwritten on verso: Imported from England by John Sparks. Either Lady Wilton or Miss Wilton, her calf.
Photograph of a beach and shoreline, most likely taken from Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California.

did.unittitle: Gate leading to Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of gates most likely leading to Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. There are large coniferous trees on either side of the gates and a sign that says "Private Grounds."

did.unittitle: Front door of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of one of the front door leading into Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. It is a narrow wooden door with a thick stone arch surrounding it.

did.unittitle: Exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. The mansion has a long main branch with two smaller branches at each end. There is a car parked on the right side of the photograph.

did.unittitle: Exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. There is a table with an umbrella above it and four chairs around it next to the mansion.

relatedmaterial.p: This photograph is the horizontal reverse of photograph 01367.

did.unittitle: Exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. It is the end of one of the short branches of the mansion. There is a window in the center of the wall.

did.unittitle: Man sitting on a car outside of Maud Sparks MacKenzie’s mansion

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the exterior of Maud Sparks MacKenzie's mansion in Carmel, California. It is the end of a short branch of the mansion where there are some large double doors where a car could be parked. There is a car parked on the right side of the photo with an unidentified man sitting on the front bumper.
Postcard from a portrait of James MacKenzie, the husband of Maud Sparks MacKenzie.

Kodachrome print photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. wearing a flannel shirt and gray jacket. He is standing in front of some coniferous trees. Photograph was made by the Eastman Kodak Company, Dec. 23, 1946.
Photograph of Nancy Lee Sparks wearing a colorful shirt and a red jacket with a gold Christmas tree pin. She is smiling at the camera.

did.unittitle: Fred Humiston and Benton H. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Fred Humiston (Nancy Lee Sparks' husband) sitting on a couch with Benton H. Sparks. Fred is wearing a red sweater and Benton is wearing a brown suit. Benton is telling one of his many stories to Fred.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Fred Humiston listening to one of the many stories of Benton Sparks (son of Gov. Sparks).

did.unittitle: Monument to John Sparks with the bust on top

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the monument to John Sparks in the Masonic Memorial Cemetery in Reno, Nevada. There are other monuments and headstones visible in the background.

Photograph of Patricia Clarkin Sparks and Leland Sparks Jr. Patricia is wearing a white dress with red white and flowers on her left shoulder. Leland is wearing a gray suit with a white boutineer. He is kissing Patricia's left temple.

Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. and Patricia Clarkin Sparks standing at the end of a table covered in a blue tablecloth with plates, napkins, and a three tiered cake. They are smiling and looking to the right of the camera.
Photograph of Patricia Clarkin Sparks sitting at a countertop in a kitchen. In the background is a brick chimney, door, and an unidentified woman.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. making a face and waving his arms at the camera. He is wearing a blue and yellow plaid shirt.

Photograph of Fred Humiston and Patricia Clarkin Sparks sitting on some rocks with part of a picnic lunch in front of them. In the background is a stream. Photograph processed by Kodak in December 1973.
Photograph of Patricia Clarkin Sparks and Leland Jr. Sparks leaning on a metal guardrail. There is a stream in the background.

Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. about to pour a drink into a cup in a kitchen. In front of him is a small cooler and some other bottles. Behind him is an unidentified woman. Processed by Kodak in Jan 1969.
Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. walking along a stream which goes under a bridge in the background. Leland is wearing a flannel shirt, jeans, and a cowboy hat. Processed by Kodak in Dec 1973.

Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. and Patricia Clarkin Sparks standing next to a wooden gate to a corral. There is a grassy hillside in the background. Leland is wearing overalls and a short-sleeved shirt while Patricia is wearing a white blouse and black pants.

did.unittitle: Fred Humiston and Leland Sparks Jr.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Fred Humiston and Leland Sparks Jr. sitting in lawn chairs on a back patio. There is a corner of a terrace behind them.
Photograph of a woman (possibly Helen Sparks) and Benton H. Sparks sitting on a couch. Helen is wearing a gray checkered suit and Benton is wearing a brown suit.

did.unittitle: Benton H. and Patricia Clarkin Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Patricia Clarkin Sparks and Benton H. Sparks sitting on a couch together. Patricia is wearing a pink shirt with white pants while Benton is wearing a brown suit.
Photograph of Benton H. Sparks sitting on a couch. He is wearing a brown suit and has a black bag and brown cane next to him.

did.unittitle: Leland Jr. and Patricia Sparks in a church

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. walking a woman down the center aisle of a church. There are large stained glass windows in the background between arches in the church.

did.unittitle: Nancy Lee, Allie, and Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Nancy Lee Sparks, Allie Burwitz Sparks, and Leland Sparks Jr. standing in a backyard.

Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. wearing shorts, a white t-shirt, and a hat while "prospecting" for gold with a gold pan. Handwritten on verso: Daddy Lee Sparks The Prospector on the San Antonio Creek, Calaveras County - at "the Ranch" 1976.

Photograph of Allie Burwitz Sparks, Leland Sr., Leland Jr., and Leland Jr.'s kids sitting around a dinner table. Photograph was processed by the Eastman Kodak Company on August 22, 1955. Handwritten on verso: Xmas 1953.

did.unittitle: Patricia Clarkin Sparks’ parents in a car

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Patricia Clarkin Sparks' parents sitting in a car. Handwritten on verso: Clarkin Folks car - their first in many many years.

Photograph of a landscape with a telephone pole in the foreground, fields and trees in the middle ground, and snow covered mountains in the background. Handwritten on verso: The view out our bedroom window.

did.unittitle: Leland Sparks Jr. in front of an airplane

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr. standing in front of an airplane with the following on the side: Hawkins Powers Aviation, 124. Handwritten on verso: Lee Sparks in front of one of the last 7 or 8 PB 4 1/2. Now used to fight fires - under contract to USFS. Stripped of all armor & arms. Carrys 10 tons of Slurry: contract say they shall be airborne in 15 min after called. One had cracked up the week before. Insured for $130,000. but worth much more. at Elko Nev. Airport. Aug/Sept 1975.

did.unittitle: Doug Radovich, Leland Jr., and Patricia Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Doug Radovich, Leland Sparks Jr, and Patricia Clarkin Sparks sitting at a dining table. In the background is an upright piano with ocats and purses in front of it and a staircase leading upstairs. Handwritten on verso: Doug Radovich, Dad & Mom Sparks 1977.

did.unittitle: Bill, Delores, and Terry with Leland Jr. and Patricia Sparks outside a church

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the members of the Moore family with Patricia and Leland Jr. Sparks outside of a church. Handwritten on verso: Bill Moore, Mom/Dad Sparks, Delores Moore, Terry Moore.

Photograph of Lillian Moore standing in front of a white house. She is wearing a white shirt, black skirt, black jacket, and black hat. Photograph produced by the Eastman Kodak Company on March 2, 1957. Handwritten on verso: July 1956 Lillian.

Photograph of Helen Sparks sitting in a chair with Benton K. Sparks crouching next to her. Helen is wearing a yellow dress and Benton is wearing a black suit. Photograph produced by the Kodak company in October 1969.

did.unittitle: Patricia and Leland Sparks Jr. with their eight kids

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Leland Sparks Jr., Patricia Clarkin Sparks, and their eight kids posed for a family photo. The names of the kids are John, Thomas, Patricia Ann, Anthony Charles, Katherine, Nancy Jo, Diane, and George Benton.

did.unittitle: Group photo at Allie Sparks’ 100th birthday party

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the Sparks family gathered together for a group photo at Allie Burwitz Sparks' 100th birthday party. The group mostly consists of Allie's children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. Allie is sitting on the edge of the stage third from the right, Nancy Lee and Frank Humiston are fourth and fifth from the right in the row second from the top, and Leland Sparks Jr is in the center of the back row. Handwritten on verso: Nana Sparks 100th B.D.

did.unittitle: Two men at the chuckwagon of a Sparks Hunting Party

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two men standing at the chuckwagon of a Sparks hunting party. The man on the left is unidentified and the man on the right is the cook, Jeff.

did.unittitle: John Sparks holding a fishing pole

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks holding a fishing pole next to a river. Behind him are some large bushes.

Photograph of a large Hereford cow with two colors. A group of men is standing behind the cow, which is most likely of of John Sparks' prizewinning cows. Handwritten on verso: Uncle Beenie said (in 1975) this bull was Perfection II bought at a Kansas City, Mo. cattle auction by his father [John Sparks]. WT 2630 at maturity probably under a year at the time of picture. Picture taken out on the 'Alamo Stock Farm.'

relatedmaterial.p: The cow in this photograph is the same as in photos 00967 and 01431.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a large Hereford cow with two colors, possibly Perfection II, a cow John Sparks bought at an auction. There is a group of men standing behind the cow. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno.

did.unittitle: Governor Sparks with the Eagle Band

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks with a portion of the Eagle Band, a local brass band based in Carson City. John Sparks is standing fifth from the right in the back row of the photograph.

Albumen photograph of a group of men standing and sitting around a campsite with horses. They are eating dinner. Caption on front: No 17 "Dinner on huntin green." Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of five men working on a branding fire. In the background are men on horseback around cattle. Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of men on horseback near a herd of cattle. One of the cowboys has roped a calf. Caption on front: No 17 Ropin a calf for dinner. Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of three saddled horses standing in a plain. Caption on the front: No 33 Cow Ponies. Glad to rest. Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of a group of men sitting in front of wagons eating dinner. Caption on front: No 1. Supper on Round Up No 1. Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of cowboys working to brand a calf. One of the cowboys on horseback is pulling the calf using a rope and the other five are standing around the calf. relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Albumen photograph of cowboys and horses standing around camp. There is a tent on the left and a wagon on the right. There is also a stack of tree branches in the foreground. Caption on front: No 29 After Dinner. Most likely taken in Wyoming. Photograph mounted by C. D. Kirkland.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the photograph (unknown source): Spks cattle in Wyo.

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of Nancy Elnora Knight. She has her hair curled and is wearing a dark dress with a small string of pearls at her neck. Cabinet card prepared by Kirkland.

did.unittitle: Maud Sparks and three girls in a window

scopecontent.p: Carte de visite of four girls standing or sitting around a window with a lace curtain in it. They are all holding dolls. Maud Sparks is the girl on the upper left.
Cabinet card of Maud Sparks. She is wearing a headband that wraps around her chin and a dress with a ruffled collar.
Portrait of Maud Sparks in profile. She is wearing her hair pulled up and a dress with poofy shoulders. Photograph prepared by Henry Van der Weyde.
Portrait of Maud Sparks looking to the right. She is wearing her head pulled up and a dress with poofy shoulders. Photograph prepared by Henry Van der Weyde.
Photograph of Maud Sparks looking down towards her lap. She is wearing a dark colored spotted dress with a broach at her throat.
Photograph of Maud Sparks sitting in a large chair. She is wearing a light colored dress with one arm resting on the arm of the chair. Photograph prepared by Theodore C. Marceau.

Silver gelatin photograph of a bust carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie. The bust is of Ruth Searles Sparks, the possible first wife of Leland Sparks Sr. It is in profile, showing the right side of the bust. Handwritten behind the photograph: Ruth Serles Sparks 1st wife of Leland Sparks (Sr).

Silver gelatin photograph of a bust carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie. The bust is of Ruth Searles Sparks, the possible first wife of Leland Sparks Sr. The bust is facing the camera, showing the front of the bust.

Silver gelatin photograph of a bust carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie. The bust is of Ruth Searles Sparks, the possible first wife of Leland Sparks Sr. The back of the bust is showing, displaying the loose bow used to tie back Ruth's hair.

Silver gelatin photograph of a bust carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie. The bust is of Ruth Searles Sparks, the possible first wife of Leland Sparks Sr. It is in profile, showing the left side of the bust.

Silver gelatin photograph of a bust carved by Maud Sparks MacKenzie. The bust is of Ruth Searles Sparks, the possible first wife of Leland Sparks Sr. The bust is facing the camera, showing the front of the bust.
Photograph of Benton K. Sparks, son of Benton H. Sparks, sitting on a bench wearing a suit.

did.unittitle: John Sparks, son of Leland Jr. Sparks, in front of a mirror

scopecontent.p: Photograph of John Sparks, son of Leland Sparks Jr., standing in front of a mirror and kissing his reflection. Handwritten on verso: Johnnie about 18 mo. "I think I'm pretty sweet. Guess I'll give me a kiss." Prepared by the Eastman Kodak Company on Dec. 18, 1950.
Cyanotype of a horse standing in a field. There is a fence in the background.

did.unittitle: Floral couch in a living room

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the living room in a house. There is a couch with a small table in front of it and two tables on either side holding lamps. There are some other chairs and a desk visible in the room.

did.unittitle: Six men around a casket covered in flowers

scopecontent.p: Photograph of six men wearing suits standing at the end of a coffin covered in flowers. There are some people and cars in the background. Handwritten on verso: Grandma N- Gran shormin 6 Grandsons as pall bearers left to right - Clyde N- Jn, Naddel N, Virgil N, Andrew N, Rucker N, Philip Amy.

did.unittitle: Adobe building with wooden lean tos

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an adobe building with wooden lean tos in front of it.

did.unittitle: Ocean bay with a boat on the water

Photograph of a three story building which has a turret on the left of the photo. No identification.

did.unittitle: Four men sitting in a swimming hole

scopecontent.p: Photograph of four men sitting in a natural pool of water with a directional gate feeding water into the pool. Handwritten on verso: Swimming Hole H. D. Ranch. Keil, Sanderson, Sessions, Dorsey.
Photograph of two dogs on a lawn. One of the dogs is sitting on the grass and the other is a puppy sitting in a box. There is an unidentified man standing on the right side of the photo.

did.unittitle: Front entrance to a large building

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the large front entrance to a building complex. There is a large road with many plants in planters leading up to the entrance.
Photograph of a mausoleum with wrought iron doors, corinthian columns, and sphinx sculptures at the front. Handwritten on verso: Hanfords fam Vault.

did.unittitle: Drawing of the surrender of Santa Anna

scopecontent.p: Hand drawn depiction of the surrender of Santa Anna on April 23, 1836. There is a key to the people present in the photo, but there are no visible numbers near the people.

did.unittitle: Christmas card featuring Elnora Sparks Howard

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Christmas card featuring young Elnora Sparks Howard standing on a chair. Handwritten on front: Merry Xmas, Elnora Sparks Howard. In the bottom right corner is a small calendar for the year 1906.
Portrait of an unidentified young man. He has a part on the left side of his head, a cowlick, and a long, narrow face. He is also wearing a suit.

relatedmaterial.p: "Found in an envelope addressed to: Chas. M. Sparks. Carson City, Nev. Portrait has been stored in a box with cabinet cards from the collection. "

Photograph of a portrait of a young girl wearing a white dress and her hair in a braid with a white bow at the end. She has her left hand resting against her head.

Group of three photos of unidentified boys posing for photographs. In the top photo, both boys are smiling at the camera. In the middle photo, the boys have switched spots and the boy on the left is wearing a cowboy hat. In the bottom photo, the boy on the left is wearing a cowboy hat and the boy on the right is wearing a derby cap.

did.unittitle: Unidentified woman sitting on a bridge

scopecontent.p: Photograph of six women, possibly a part of a performing troupe. The woman in the front on the right looks like it could be Maud Sparks. In the background is a changing screen and some drapery.

did.unittitle: Ranch hand sitting in a horsedrawn buggy

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man in working clothes sitting in a buggy being drawn by a horse. There is a large tree in a background. Handwritten on verso: June-26-1911-. No identification.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a wide door with a heart shaped wreath hanging on the door.
Photograph of an intersection of two neighborhood roads. There seems to be a park on the left, a horse-drawn carriage is going along one of the road, and a blue car in the foreground.
Photograph of snow covered trees in a forested area. There is a small clearing in front of some of the trees.
Photograph of a diagonal perspective of looking up a coniferous tree with some deciduous trees nearby.

did.unittitle: Front door with candles and Noel

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the front door to a house around Christmas time. The window next to the door is surrounded by Christmas lights and have a Santa figurine in the window. The front door also has some candles and the word Noel on it.
Photograph of a snow covered landscape consisting of tree covered hills.
Photograph of a snow covered road lined by trees on either side. Some branches and bushes have fallen into the road.
Photograph of a snow covered landscape consisting of a canyon with trees going up either slope.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a large tree with pink blossoms in front of a house.

relatedmaterial.p: The back of the photograph has pink paper attached, indicating that it may have been a part of the album put together for Allie Burwitz Sparks' 100th birthday.

did.unittitle: Birthday for a kid of Leland Jr. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a birthday party with four girls and four boys standing at the end of the table, possibly for one of the children of Leland Sparks Jr. A man is sitting on the left side of the photograph (possibly Leland Sparks Jr.). The photograph was produced by Kodak in Jan 1970.

did.unittitle: Man in a suit standing in front of a car

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified man wearing a high-waisted suit with a bowtie and cap standing in front of two cars. One is parked on a driveway and the other on a street. Photograph was produced by Kodak in February 1959.
Photograph of a Native American teepee set up in a field. There are a couple buildings in the background along with a mountain range.

did.unittitle: Painter in front of an easel holding a painting palette

scopecontent.p: Cyanotype of a man holding a painting palette and looking at an easel. There is a bush behind him. No identification.

did.unittitle: Baby being held by its mother

scopecontent.p: Carte de visite of a baby being held by its mother. The baby is wearing a white garment and looking at something to the right of the camera. No identification.
Carte de visite of an unidentified man wearing a suit and tie with an overcoat. He has a heart shaped face and his hair brushed back.

did.unittitle: Unidentified girl with a bow in her hair

scopecontent.p: Portrait of a young girl sitting and looking to the left. She is wearing a white dress and has her hair unbound except for a headband tied in a bow at the top of her head. No identification.
Cabinet card of an unidentified woman sitting with her face in profile. She is wearing a dark colored dress. Cabinet card prepared by Johnshon.
Photograph of an unidentified man and woman. The man is wearing a suit and tie and the woman is wearing a white lacy patterned dress.
Photograph of an unidentified man wearing a suit and tie. He has his hair parted on the left side of his head and his hair brushed back.

relatedmaterial.p: Duplicate of photo 00158.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified mother and baby posing for a portrait. The mother is wearing a dress with a lace collar and the baby is wearing a white dress and holding a rattle.
Cabinet card of a stern looking woman wearing a dark colored dress with a flower broach at her neck. Her hair is short and curled. Cabinet card was processed by C. H. Gallup & Co.
Cabinet card of an unidentified baby sitting on a floor. The baby is wearing a lace covered dress. Cabinet card was processed by N. M. Wilcox.

did.unittitle: Unidentified woman with a broach at her throat

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an unidentified woman wearing a high collared dress with a broach at her neck. Her hair is pulled back. Cabinet card was prepared by The Cottage Studio.

Boudoir card of an unidentified man and woman. The man is sitting in an upholstered chair and the woman is standing next to him with her right hand rested on his shoulder. She has a scarf draped over her left arm. The backdrop is a wall with a window in it. Boudoir card prepared by S. B. Hill.
Photograph from a balcony overlooking a town. There is a plant at the edge of the balcony. Handwritten on verso: Hontenay.
Photograph of a cobblestone city with shops on either side. At the end of the street is a building with a staircase leading up to it. Handwritten on verso: Langian.
Photograph of an unidentified woman standing near a stone structure, possibly a well or oven. In the background are a couple houses. Handwritten on verso: Near Chambud.
Carte de visite of two men on horseback. The man on the right is possibly John Sparks.
Carte de visite of five men sitting for a photograph. They are all dressed as rangers or ranch hands and holding lassos in their hands. The man on the middle right may be a Sparks (possibly John).

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the card (unknown source): John Sparks upper rt (Tx Rangers?)

did.unittitle: Woman on horseback approaching a building

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a woman on horseback approaching a building with a wooden awning extending from the front of the house. Photograph prepared by Hirsch & Kaiser.

did.unittitle: Unidentified boy wearing a plaid jacket and skirt

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an unidentified young boy wearing a plaid jacket and skirt. He is leaning against a short stone pillar wrapped in ivy. Cabinet card prepared by Kirkland.

did.unittitle: Unidentified man wearing a sweater with an N

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified man wearing a knit turtleneck sweater with an N on the chest. He has a square face and is not smiling.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified young man wearing a suit with a high collar and a skinny bowtie. His hair is parted in the middle.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a young woman wearing a dress. Her hair is done up. Handwritten on verso: Ethel Sparks. Photograph produced by Dann.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a young woman wearing a high collared dress with an attached chest panel. Her hair is pinned up in a bun. Handwritten on verso: Mabell Sparks. Photograph produced by Dann.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a young man wearing a high collared shirt, skinny bowtie, and graduation regalia. Handwritten on front (partially smudged); Truly - C. Eskau Jr. Handwritten on verso: I am not so cranky as I look. N. S. U. '03. Photograph produced by Dann.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified young man wearing a suit. He has a round face, wide set earts, and his hair is parted in the middle.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified young man wearing a suit with a long tie. He is looking to the right of the camera and his hair is a little messy. Handwritten on verso: A. T. Taylor. S. A. O3. N. S.U.

relatedmaterial.p: Photograph was part of a stack of portraits (photos 01553-01559) and tied together using a piece of string.

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an unidentified young man wearing a suit and bowtie. His hair is parted on the left side of his head. Cabinet card was prepared by G. A. Addison.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the card (unknown source): Thos or John Sparks.

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an elderly unidentified woman wearing a dark covered dress. She has a small shawl pinned around her neck and is holding a light colored handkerchief. Cabinet card prepared by Wilcox.

relatedmaterial.p: Caption with the card (unknown source): poss Gov [Sparks] mother or grandmother. [It is not John Sparks' mother.]

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified man wearing a suit, tie, and a tie pin. Photographer: Dann.
Photograph of an unidentified man wearing a suit, tie, and two pins on his lapels. He has a long, square face. Photographer: Dann.

Portrait of an unidentified young woman. Her back is to the camera and she is looking over her right shoulder toward the camera. She is wearing a shoulderless dress with a lace pattern, roses on the right side, and her hair in a bun with more roses.

relatedmaterial.p: The woman in this photograph is the same person as in photograph 01566.

scopecontent.p: Portrait of an unidentified young woman facing the camera and looking to her left. She is wearing a shoulderless dress with a lace pattern, roses on the left side, a small seashell-shaped necklace, and her hair in a bun with more roses.

Portrait of an unidentified young woman in an angled profile with the right side of her face visible to the camera. She is wearing a shoulderless dress with a lace pattern, roses on the right side, a circular necklace with a shamrock, and her hair in a bun with more roses.

relatedmaterial.p: The woman in this photograph is the same person as in photograph 01564.

did.unittitle: Unidentified children sitting on a rock

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two small children wearing dresses and caps sitting on a rock. In the backgorund is a rocky cliff face. No identification.
Cabinet card of an unidentified woman with a heart shaped face. Her hair is pulled back in a bun and she is wearing a dress with floral patterns along the edges.

did.unittitle: John Sparks, son of Benton H. Sparks

scopecontent.p: Portrait of John Sparks, son of Benton and Ada Sparks. He is wearing a suit with a striped tie. Handwritten on verso: John Sparks Benton & Ada Sparks Son. Photographer: Louis Huntress.
Carte de visite of a baby being held by an adult. The baby is wearing a checkered dress and one of the adult's hands is resting on the baby's head. Handwritten on verso: Your self. No identification.

did.unittitle: Two women next to four dogs

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two unidentified women standing near five dogs in a yard. There is a fence in the background. Possibly taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno.
Photograph of a young unidentified woman wearing a long overcoat and a hat with ribbons.

did.unittitle: Group of people standing on the front porch of a building

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men and women standing on the front porch of a large house. There are stone pillars at the edges of the porch and the steps are covered with a carpet that extends to a small raised platform. The men and women are dressed in formal wear. Photograph prepared by Wilcox & Chapman.

did.unittitle: Reproduction of a painting by Jules Bastien-LePage

scopecontent.p: Reproduction of a painting by Jules Bastien-LePage of a portrait of Sarah Bernheardt. Caption on front: A Sarah Bernhardt Jules Bastien-LePage 1879.

did.unittitle: Unidentified woman standing with a painting palette

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified woman standing near a wall with some pictures hung around the walls. She is holding some sort of basket and wearing a dark dress with a white cap.
Cabinet card of an unidentified young woman wearing a dress with some flaps on the front. She is wearing a decorative cap, a locket, and a cross. Cabinet card prepared by D. D. Dare.
Portrait of an unidentified young man with wavy hair wearing an overcoat with poofy sleeves.

did.unittitle: Two story ranch house with men and woman on the front porch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of men and women on the front porch of a two story ranch house. Behind the house is a cow and a hill. No identification.
Photograph of a single story stone building with a square front where a door and windows are. The sides of the building have sloped roofs.
Photograph of an unidentified child who is one year old. She is sitting on a wicker bench wearing a dress and holding a toy ball. Handwritten on verso: Me 1 year.
Photograph of an unidentified child laying on their stomach on a flat surface covered by a cloth. Handwritten on front: Patsy. Handwritten on verso: Me 6 mos.
Photograph of two unidentified men with their mouths open like they are laughing.

did.unittitle: Woman working on a painting with umbrellas around her

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two unknown women. One them is facing the camera holding an umbrella over a painting while the second woman is facing away from the camera and focused on the painting. No identification.

did.unittitle: Two men leaning on a picket fence

scopecontent.p: Photograph of two unidentified men standing on the opposite side of a picket fence from the cameraman. There is a large tent behind the fence with a stove coming out of it. Inscripted on the front: Pocket Kodak.
Photograph of an unidentified young man wearing a suit with a long tie. He is visible in profile. There is a tree and a yard with a fence in the background behind him.
Small portrait of an unidentified young man wearing a suit and tie. No identification.
Photograph of an unidentified woman. She is wearing a dress with a lacey veil or shawl over her hair and covering her shoulders.
Carte de visite of an unidentified woman wearing a dress with an apron and a ruffled collar. There is an apron around her waist and she is standing next to a short square pillar covered with a cloth.

did.unittitle: Unidentified young man in a suit

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an unidentified young man dressed in a suit with a watch chain and a medal on his lapel. He is standing next to a wicker lawn chair.
Cabinet card of an unidentified man wearing a suit with a white bowtie and watch chain. He is standing with his arms behind his back. Cabinet card was prepared by Riverside Studios.
Carte de visite of an unidentified baby sitting in a dress. Carte de visite was prepared by W. H. Masters.
Carte de visite of an unidentified young girl wearing a light colored dress with a dark, fur-lined jacket over it. She is resting her arms on a cushion. Photographer: W. W. Sawyer.

did.unittitle: Unidentified man with a polka dot tie

scopecontent.p: Cabinet card of an unidentified man wearing a suit with a polka dot tie. He is posed so that the right side of his face is visible. Cabinet card prepared by Riverside Studios.

Photograph made of two images. The image on the left is of a baby in a white garment. The image on the right is the same baby being held by a young boy wearing a suit sitting in a chair. No identification.
Albumen print of buildings at the Wedekind mine, located east of Reno. A sign on one of the buildings reads "G. M. Sparks General Merchandise." Handwritten on verso: Wedekind Mine.

did.unittitle: Two women standing at a fence

scopecontent.p: Albumen print of two women wearing dresses and looking past a fence. They are standing next to a bush. No identification.
Albumen print of an unidentified woman sitting on the side of a hill. She is wearing a dress.
Partial photograph of an unidentified boy standing in a field. He is wearing a checkered jacket.
Albumen print of four unidentified young men wearing suits. Two are standing and two are sitting. The man on the bottom left is smiling goofily.
Photograph of an unidentified woman wearing a headscarf and dress suit. Behind her is a dog running in a field.

Albumen print of four dogs, three standing and one laying down by a house. The smallest dog is interacting with the dog laying down. The dogs possibly belong to the Sparks family. Handwritten on verso: The family dogs.
Albumen print of a young woman sitting confidently behind the wheel of a motorcar. There are trees in the background. No identification.

did.unittitle: Herd of sheep next to a fence

scopecontent.p: Albumen print of a herd of sheep next to a fence. In another pasture is a herd of cattle.
Photograph of a landscape of Yosemite National Park which has Half Dome visible on the right side of the image. Photograph developed by Bear Photo Service on September 5, 1940.

did.unittitle: Half Dome at Yosemite National Park

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a landscape of Yosemite National Park in which Half Dome is visible. Photograph developed by Bear Photo Service on September 5, 1940.
Photograph of a tower with mountains in the background.

did.unittitle: Boy and girl in front of a barn

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a boy and girl standing next to a beam in a farm yard. Behind them is a barn and a fence. No identification.
Albumen print of an unidentified woman sitting in a wooden chair writing a note on the arm of the chair. There is a drink on the other arm of the chair. She appears to be sitting on a covered porch.
Albumen print of a man on horseback next to a boy and two dogs. The man is holding some kind of sack in his hand. No identification.

did.unittitle: Four men in front of a Christmas tree

scopecontent.p: Albumen print of four men sitting in front of a Christmas tree in a living room. The light from the window behind the tree is silhouetting the men, making identification difficult.

did.unittitle: Herd of cattle in a field

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a herd of cattle in a field. There is sagebrush surrounding the field.

did.unittitle: Hunting party with some bears strung up

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a group of men and dogs posing for a picture next to a tree. There are some bears strung up from trees. Possibly a part of a Sparks hunting party.
Albumen print of a two story house with a fence in front of it.

did.unittitle: Man driving a wagon drawn by two horses

scopecontent.p: Albumen print of a covered buggy being drawn by two horses and driven by an unidentified man.

did.unittitle: Man and woman fishing at a stream

scopecontent.p: Albumen print of an unidentified man and woman standing near a river. The man is holding a fishing pole over the river and the woman is watching him.

did.unittitle: Fireplace with a mounted bison head

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a fireplace in a home. Above the fireplace are six flower vases. There is a bison head trophy mounted above the fireplace.
Photograph of four women standing on a golfing green holding golf clubs. They are wearing bowler hats and looking at the camera. No identification.

did.unittitle: Unidentified woman sitting on a fence

scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified woman sitting on the edge of a fence in a corral. She is wearing a long trench coat and a hat.

did.unittitle: Man with a stack of sacks

did.unittitle: Car damaged by an electrical wire

did.unittitle: Car damaged by an electrical wire

scopecontent.p: Photograph of the electrical damage done to a Pontiac car. The photograph shows the hole in the trunk caused by the damage from the inside of the trunk cover.

did.unittitle: Photograph of a Sparks family dinner with Leland Jr. at the head

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a Sparks Family dinner. Around the dinner table: Leland Jr., Frank Humiston, Nancy Lee Sparks Humiston, children of Leland and Patricia, and Patricia Sparks. Leland is standing at the head of the table holding a dish. Handwritten on verso: 1965.

did.unittitle: Photograph of a dog in a backyard

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a backyard with a dog walking toward the person taking the photo. There is a clothesline and what looks like a duck in the yard. Handwritten on verso: 1966.
Photograph of a two story building in Round Rock, Texas, where stagecoach lodgings were located. The second story of the building has a balcony on it. Handwritten on verso: Round Rock stage lodgings.

did.unittitle: Trees surrounding a house and adjacent buildings

scopecontent.p: Photograph of trees along a road and in the yard in front of a house. There is some lawn furniture by one of the buildings in front of the house. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Trees at old place and coemp [?] between gabriel rivers.
Photograph of a small single room cinder block building between bushes and trees. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas.

did.unittitle: Daisy Montgomery in front of a house

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a woman named Daisy Montgomery standing behind a thin bush in front of a two story house. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Daisy Montgomery.
Photograph of a small wooden house with trees around it and a road in the front. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas.
Photograph of a field and a fence. There is a tree overhanging the fence. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Brushy Grove, Old Brushy Grove.
Photograph of a bridge with a town on the other side of the bridge. In the foreground is a metal wire fence. Possibly taken near Georgetown, Texas. Handwritten on verso: Bridge looking north.

did.unittitle: Tree with four trunks and two men standing next to it

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a tree with cleared ground underneath it. On the left side of the image are two people standing. Caption attached to verso: Burial place of three men. Dr. James knight Born July 11o', 1776, died Jan. 1848. A native of Maryland, of English decent. Married (in Penn) Martha Seals (widow of Benj. Smalley) she was a native of Pennsylvania. Died in Danville I11., there burried. Had eight children. Dr. James Knight came to Texas when he was 71, for his health. Lived one year. He is burried two miles north east of Round Rock, near Brushey river, under two trees, now on the Nelson Farm, and in view of paved highway. Dr. William Knight, son of Dr. James Knight. Born Apr. 28, 1799, died Feb 11, 1851. he married Mary Anderson Baugh. She is burried in Georgetown, Presbyterian cemetary. Great aunt Martha Alleys first husband ___ Macomson was the third person burried under these trees. He came with his father (in law) bringing his family. (The stones are broken and bent. Cattle have browsed over it.)

did.unittitle: Martin Van Buren Sparks and three men golfing

scopecontent.p: Photograph of Martin Van Buren Sparks standing next to three other gentlemen. They are wearing golfing clothes, derby caps, and holding golf clubs.

did.unittitle: Bison possibly at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a bison in a field, possibly belonging to John Sparks. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada.

did.unittitle: Young bighorn sheep at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

scopecontent.p: Photograph of a young bighorn sheep, possibly belonging to John Sparks. It is standing in front of a chicken wire fence and wearing a collar. Most likely taken at the Sparks Alamo ranch in Reno, Nevada.
Photograph of a ranch barn with "Alamo Hereford Stock Farm," painted on the roof. The Sparks Alamo ranch was located in Reno, Nevada.
Photograph of a barn at the Sparks Alamo Ranch in Reno, Nevada. The center of the photograph is overexposed, washing out the details.

did.unittitle: Hereford cow at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

did.unittitle: Hereford cow at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

did.unittitle: Mule deer at the Sparks Alamo Ranch

The woman on the left is wearing a white shirt and black skirt with a bowtie and the one on the right is wearing a white dress. The man is wearing a suit and a light colored bowler cap. THe woman on the left is Maud Sparks.

Photograph of a stream with a road running perpendicular to the stream on either side. There is a black cow standing next to the bank. There are some trees on both sides of the banks.
